title: Buy Cummins India; target of Rs 4500: Mirae Asset Sharekhan
content: Mirae Asset Sharekhan's research report on Cummins India Cummins is experiencing a broad-based demand revival in powergen segment from across sectors such as Real estate, manufacturing, hospitals, datacenters, etc. Demand is picking up with price stabilization. High-HP products has seen a steady demand from Data centers, hospitals etc. Cummins emerging as a clear leader owing to early product launches, strong customer adoption, and aftermarket support. While CPCB IV+ volumes are currently tracking at 80–85% of CPCB-II levels, prices have largely held firm. Outlook We expect a 16%/16% CAGR in revenue/PAT (FY25-27E). Given the domestic demand uptick due to adoption of CPCB-IV emission norms and gradual recovery in export business, we maintain a Buy rating with a revised PT of Rs 4,500. For all recommendations report, click here Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions. Cummins India - 16092025 - khan

title: L&T shares higher by a percent on 'significant' order of up to Rs 2,500 crore from NPCIL for Kudankulam nuclear plant
content: Engineering and construction giant L&T has bagged a 'significant' order worth up to Rs 2,500 crore from Nuclear Power Corporation (NPCIL) for the Kudankulam power project in Tamil Nadu, the company informed on September 16, sending the shares higher by a percent. The order was won by the Heavy Civil Infrastructure (HCI) vertical of L&T for 2x1000 Mwe Kudankulam Nuclear Power Project (KKNPP 5 & 6) which would involve installation of the reactor and turbine systems, sea water systems, and other related equipment. The order also includes accessories such as piping, structural steelwork, anti-corrosion coating, insulation and full testing across the structures. The HCI business is an EPC division for core civil infrastructure projects crucial to sectors such as Metros and High-Speed Rail (HSR), tunnels, nuclear power, ports as well as defence infrastructure. This business undertakes civil construction works for nuclear power plants and has expertise in construction of Pressurised Heavy Water Reactors (PHWR), Light Water Reactors (LWR) and Natural Draft Cooling Towers (NDCT). As part of the Viksit Bharat initiative, India has set a target of 100 GW nuclear power capacity by 2047, which will be supported by the Nuclear Energy Mission, including significant investments in R&D for Small Modular Reactors (SMRs). Centre has been looking to enhance domestic nuclear capabilities and private sector participation in such projects. During the June quarter earnings, L&T pegged the prospective order pipeline for infra for the next nine months at Rs 7.97 trillion, a rise of 32 percent on year. This prospects pipeline comprises of domestic prospects of Rs 5.04 trillion and international prospects of Rs 2.93 trillion. The sub-segment of Heavy Civil Infrastructure will make up for 17 percent of the total order prospects, the company has said. The orderbook for this segment is at Rs 3.7 trillion as of June 2025.
summary_lexrank: Engineering and construction giant L&T has bagged a 'significant' order worth up to Rs 2,500 crore from Nuclear Power Corporation (NPCIL) for the Kudankulam power project in Tamil Nadu, the company informed on September 16, sending the shares higher by a percent.
summary_luhn: The order was won by the Heavy Civil Infrastructure (HCI) vertical of L&T for 2x1000 Mwe Kudankulam Nuclear Power Project (KKNPP 5 & 6) which would involve installation of the reactor and turbine systems, sea water systems, and other related equipment.
summary_lsa: Centre has been looking to enhance domestic nuclear capabilities and private sector participation in such projects.
summary_textrank: The order was won by the Heavy Civil Infrastructure (HCI) vertical of L&T for 2x1000 Mwe Kudankulam Nuclear Power Project (KKNPP 5 & 6) which would involve installation of the reactor and turbine systems, sea water systems, and other related equipment.

title: Larsen & Toubro shares rise 1.07% to Rs 3,624.40
content: Shares of Larsen & Toubro were trading positively in Tuesday's session, with the stock priced at Rs 3,624.40, a 1.07% increase from the previous close. The stock touched a day's high of Rs 3,626.00 and a day's low of Rs 3,593.10 at 10:40 am. Larsen & Toubro is included as one of the stocks in the benchmark Nifty 50 index. Financial Performance: The following table summarizes the consolidated financial performance of Larsen & Toubro:ParticularsJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025Revenue (Rs Crore)55,119.8261,554.5864,667.7874,392.2863,678.92Net Profit (Rs Crore)3,440.114,112.814,001.036,133.444,325.57EPS20.2624.6924.4339.9826.30The revenue for Larsen & Toubro has increased from Rs 55,119.82 Crore in June 2024 to Rs 63,678.92 Crore in June 2025. title: Vodafone Idea among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150; shares decline 3.19%
content: Shares of Vodafone Idea were trading lower in Tuesday's session. At 10:30 am, the stock was trading at Rs 7.88 on the NSE, a 3.19% decline from the previous close. The stock is among the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150. The company's revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 11,022.50 Crore, compared to Rs 10,508.30 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs -6608.10 Crore, while in June 2024, the net profit was Rs -6432.20 Crore. The EPS for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs -0.63, compared to Rs -1.02 in June 2024. The following table represents the consolidated quarterly financial performance of the company:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 10,508.30 CroreRs 10,932.20 CroreRs 11,117.30 CroreRs 11,013.50 CroreRs 11,022.50 CroreNet Profit-Rs 6,432.20 Crore-Rs 7,175.60 Crore-Rs 6,609.30 Crore-Rs 7,168.10 Crore-Rs 6,608.10 CroreEPS-1.02-1.03-0.95-1.01-0.63For the year-ending March 2025, the company's revenue stood at Rs 43,571.30 Crore, compared to Rs 42,651.70 Crore in 2024. The net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs -27385.20 Crore, while in 2024, the net profit was Rs -31232.90 Crore. The EPS for the year-ending March 2025 stood at Rs -4.01, compared to Rs -6.41 in 2024. Here is a table illustrating the consolidated yearly financial performance:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 41,952.20 CroreRs 38,515.50 CroreRs 42,177.20 CroreRs 42,651.70 CroreRs 43,571.30 CroreNet Profit-Rs 44,464.50 Crore-Rs 28,246.60 Crore-Rs 29,301.60 Crore-Rs 31,232.90 Crore-Rs 27,385.20 CroreEPS-15.40-9.83-8.43-6.41-4.01BVPS-13.30-19.29-15.28-20.78-9.85ROE0.000.000.000.000.00Debt to Equity-4.12-3.08-0.18-1.99-2.79Vodafone Idea has made several announcements recently. On September 10, 2025, the company released an investor presentation. On August 26, 2025, they shared the scrutinizer's report for the Annual General Meeting held on August 25, 2025, along with the voting results. Additionally, on the same day, they clarified a news article in the mainstream media under Regulation 30(11) of the SEBI Listing Regulations. Moneycontrol analysis indicates a very bullish sentiment for Vodafone Idea as of September 16, 2025. With the stock currently trading at Rs 7.88, Vodafone Idea is experiencing a decline in today's session.

title: The Tata Power Company shares surge 2.65% amid volume surge
content: The Tata Power Company's stock is currently trading at Rs 398.30, marking a 2.65% increase from its previous close. The stock is experiencing high trading volume along with a volume surge in Tuesday's session. The stock is a constituent of the NIFTY NEXT 50 index. On the financial front, The Tata Power Company has demonstrated consistent growth in both quarterly and annual results. Consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 18,035.07 Crore, up from Rs 17,293.62 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same quarter was Rs 1,132.69 Crore, compared to Rs 899.22 Crore in the previous year. The company's annual performance also reflects strong financials. The consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 reached Rs 65,478.24 Crore, a notable increase from Rs 61,448.90 Crore in March 2024. Net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 3,982.04 Crore, significantly higher than the Rs 3,102.53 Crore reported in the previous year. Key financial figures are summarized below:Financials (Consolidated)Jun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 17,293.62 CroreRs 15,697.67 CroreRs 15,391.06 CroreRs 17,095.88 CroreRs 18,035.07 CroreNet ProfitRs 899.22 CroreRs 858.00 CroreRs 1,001.36 CroreRs 1,223.44 CroreRs 1,132.69 CroreEPS3.042.903.223.263.31Financials (Consolidated)20212022202320242025RevenueRs 32,468.10 CroreRs 42,815.67 CroreRs 55,109.08 CroreRs 61,448.90 CroreRs 65,478.24 CroreNet ProfitRs 611.46 CroreRs 680.61 CroreRs 610.21 CroreRs 3,102.53 CroreRs 3,982.04 CroreEPS3.175.3610.4311.5612.42The company has also been actively involved in corporate actions. The management attended a Non-Deal Roadshow in London and Edinburgh from September 15, 2025, to September 17, 2025. Furthermore, Tata Power and Tata Passenger Electric Mobility Limited unveiled India's largest Tata.ev MegaCharger Hub on World EV Day. The Tata Power Company announced a final dividend of Rs 2.25 per share (225%) on May 14, 2025, with an effective date of June 20, 2025. The company had also announced a bonus issue on May 19, 1975, with a bonus ratio of 1:5. Moneycontrol analysis as of September 10, 2025, indicates a bullish sentiment on the stock. With the stock currently trading at Rs 398.30, The Tata Power Company exhibits strong market activity and positive financial performance.

KPR Mill led the gains with a 3.63% increase, reaching a price of Rs 1,085.00. Global Health followed, rising by 3.49% to Rs 1,371.80. MRF also saw a significant gain, increasing by 3.14% to Rs 152,035.00. Balkrishna Ind recorded a gain of 2.68%, trading at Rs 2,468.00, while GE Vernova TD saw an increase of 2.42%, reaching Rs 2,920.10. title: Page Industries shares rise 2.07% in morning trade
content: Shares of Page Industries gained 2.07% to trade at Rs 45,260 at 10:24 am on Tuesday. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty Midcap 150 index. Financial Snapshot: The standalone financial results indicate the following trends: Income Statement: The company's annual sales have increased from Rs 4,581 Crore in March 2024 to Rs 4,934 Crore in March 2025. Other income also increased to Rs 61 Crore in March 2025 compared to Rs 19 Crore in March 2024. Consequently, the total income rose to Rs 4,996 Crore in March 2025 from Rs 4,601 Crore in March 2024. Total expenditure also saw an increase, rising to Rs 3,971 Crore in March 2025 from Rs 3,800 Crore in March 2024. The Earnings Before Interest and Taxes (EBIT) increased from Rs 801 Crore in March 2024 to Rs 1,024 Crore in March 2025. The interest paid increased slightly to Rs 46 Crore in March 2025 from Rs 44 Crore in March 2024. The tax expenses increased to Rs 249 Crore in March 2025 compared to Rs 187 Crore in March 2024. The net profit increased from Rs 569 Crore in March 2024 to Rs 729 Crore in March 2025. For the quarter ending June 2025, the sales stood at Rs 1,316 Crore, which is slightly higher than the Rs 1,277 Crore in June 2024. title: Trump's tariffs bite off Rs 25,000 crore from shrimp exporters' profit, Andhra CM Chandrababu Naidu seeks Centre's help
content: Trump's tariffs may have caused a loss of Rs 25,000 crore to India's shrimp exporters, with up to half of the export orders facing cancellations, Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister N Chandrababu Naidu has said. Chandrababu Naidu pegged the estimate in a letter to Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal and Fisheries Minister Rajiv Ranjan Singh, requesting government support for Andhra's aquaculture sector. “The taxes imposed by America majorly hit shrimp exports. It is estimated that a loss of Rs 25,000 crore would have occurred. Up to 50 percent export orders have been cancelled,” Chandrababu Naidu said in the letter. Andhra Pradesh makes up 80 percent of India's shrimp exports, worth over Rs 21,000 crore every year. During FY24, India exported record volume of seafood worth $7.38 billion, with USA and China being the major importers and frozen shrimp the largest export item, according to data from Marine Products Export Development Authority (MPEDA). During FY25, India shipped seafood worth Rs 62,408 crore ($7.45 billion). Naidu has called for a Rs 100 crore corpus fund, cold storages, and seafood markets, adding that the state is ready to set up a shrimp producers' committee to ensure farm-to-market supply chains. The state government has also initiated support measures by getting aquaculture feed prices lowered by Rs 9 per kg and is considering subsidised power transformers for the farms. CM Naidu has also sought a one-time top-up loan of Rs 1 lakh under Kisan Credit Card scheme for the farmers. This comes as the European Union approved 102 additional seafood processing and export units from India just days ago, a move that will boost seafood exports and position the nation as a trusted supplier. "This milestone will enable us to scale our EU trade, empower our farmer partners, and reaffirm India’s leadership in sustainable aquaculture and seafood exports," Chairman and Managing Director of Kings Infra, Shaji Baby John said on September 10. EU-bound exports from India had reached Rs 9,430 crore ($1.12 billion) last fiscal, led by frozen shrimps among the leading items. India is also in discussions with the EU for a wider FTA, with the next round of discussions scheduled on October 6-10. The EU is the third largest export destination for Indian shrimps, with US and China being the top two markets, in terms of turnover. In terms of quantity, China has emerged as the largest seafood export destination from India. CareEdge Ratings in a recent note had warned that if the current tariff levels persist, the hit on exports may be more pronounced next fiscal, and volumes may drop by up to 15 percent. India, along with Ecuador, Vietnam, Indonesia, Thailand, and China are the largest players in the global shrimp export market with a combined market share of around 75% in value terms and 74% in volume terms. Despite the export levy, shares of Avanti Feeds and Kings Infra are higher by 10 percent and 5 percent respectively over the last one month, while shares of Waterbase are flat for the period. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

summary_luhn: Trump's tariffs may have caused a loss of Rs 25,000 crore to India's shrimp exporters, with up to half of the export orders facing cancellations, Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister N Chandrababu Naidu has said.

title: Apollo Tyres shares rise 2.02%; stock among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150

content: Shares of Global Health were trading at Rs 1,357.10, up 2.38% in Tuesday's session. The stock is among the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index at 10:07 am. The net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 481.32 Crore, slightly higher than the Rs 478.06 Crore reported in 2024. title: Godfrey Phillips shares surge 9% after turning ex-bonus: Here's why you should ignore the 66% plunge
content: The shares of Godfrey Phillips appeared to have crashed around 66 percent in one single session on September 16, as the stock price adjusted to a bonus issue of shares. The stock in reality jumped more than 9 percent after turning ex-bonus. Godfrey Phillips' board of directors during a meeting in August had approved the issue of bonus shares in the ratio of 2:1. The record date to determine the eligibility of the shareholders set to receive the bonus equity shares was set on September 16. What is a bonus issue? A company announces bonus issue of shares to reward its existing shareholders with an investment opportunity, which is perceived to be attractive. While the issue of bonus shares increases the total number of shares issued and owned, it does not change the market capitalization of the company. This increases the overall liquidity of the stock, and makes it more affordable for other investors to add to their portfolio, creating strong upside potential for the stock. Godfrey Phillips share price: Key details As a result, Godfrey Phillips’ shares appeared to have crashed 66 percent in one session, while in reality, they simply adjusted to the bonus issue. The stock jumped more than 9 percent to hit an intraday high of Rs 3,720 apiece. After the issuance of bonus shares, the company's market capitalization stands at around Rs 57,401 crore and the stock's P/E ratio nears 161. The issuance of bonus shares will likely increase investors' confidence for the stock, as it reflects on the firm's strong financials and growth potential. Bonus issue essentially are free shares offered by a company from its reserves. Investors must own shares of the company as on the record date to be eligible for the bonus issue. Also read: Our LIVE blog on stock market updates Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by experts on Moneycontrol are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.
summary_lexrank: A company announces bonus issue of shares to reward its existing shareholders with an investment opportunity, which is perceived to be attractive.
summary_luhn: The shares of Godfrey Phillips appeared to have crashed around 66 percent in one single session on September 16, as the stock price adjusted to a bonus issue of shares.
summary_lsa: The stock jumped more than 9 percent to hit an intraday high of Rs 3,720 apiece.
summary_textrank: While the issue of bonus shares increases the total number of shares issued and owned, it does not change the market capitalization of the company.

title: Vodafone Idea, Ola Electric, Glenmark stocks among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150 today
content: Indian markets saw Vodafone Idea shares decline. The stock is among the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150. At 10:00 am on Tuesday, Vodafone Idea was trading at Rs 7.96, down 2.21%. Ola Electric was trading at Rs 59.50, down 1.67%; Glenmark was trading at Rs 2,065.90, down 1.6%; Max Healthcare at Rs 1,157.60, down 1.51%; and BSE Limited at Rs 2,200.50, down 1.21%.Vodafone Idea Financial OverviewVodafone Idea's financial performance shows a mix of challenges and improvements. The company's consolidated revenue for the year ending March 2025 stood at Rs 43,571.30 Crore, an increase compared to Rs 42,651.70 Crore in the previous year. However, the company reported a net loss of Rs 27,385.20 Crore for the same period. Key financial ratios show a P/E ratio of -1.70 and a P/B ratio of -0.69. Here is a more detailed look at the company's financial performance:HeadingMar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023Mar 2022Mar 2021RevenueRs 43,571.30 CroreRs 42,651.70 CroreRs 42,177.20 CroreRs 38,515.50 CroreRs 41,952.20 CroreNet Profit-Rs 27,385.20 Crore-Rs 31,232.90 Crore-Rs 29,301.60 Crore-Rs 28,246.60 Crore-Rs 44,464.50 CroreEPS-4.01-6.41-8.43-9.83-15.40BVPS-9.85-20.78-15.28-19.29-13.30ROE0.000.000.000.000.00Debt to Equity-2.79-1.99-0.18-3.08-4.12Ola Electric FinancialsOla Electric Mobility Limited's financial data indicates significant revenue growth but persistent net losses. For the year ending March 2025, the company reported a consolidated revenue of Rs 4,514.00 Crore, compared to Rs 5,009.83 Crore in the previous year. However, the net loss for the year stood at Rs 2,276.00 Crore. Key financial ratios include a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.59. Here is a detailed look at Ola Electric's financial performance:HeadingMar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023Mar 2022RevenueRs 4,514.00 CroreRs 5,009.83 CroreRs 2,630.93 CroreRs 373.42 CroreNet Profit-Rs 2,276.00 Crore-Rs 1,584.40 Crore-Rs 1,472.08 Crore-Rs 784.15 CroreEPS-5.48-4.35-3.91-2.23BVPS11.66-4.882.809.50ROE-44.250.00-269.24-42.21Debt to Equity0.59-2.503.010.40Glenmark Pharmaceuticals FinancialsGlenmark Pharmaceuticals demonstrates consistent growth in revenue and profitability. The company's consolidated revenue for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 7,028.46 Crore, up from Rs 5,406.02 Crore in the previous year. The net profit also increased to Rs 1,075.88 Crore. Key financial ratios include a P/E ratio of 99.09 and a P/B ratio of 11.37. Below is a detailed table presenting Glenmark's financial highlights:HeadingMar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023Mar 2022Mar 2021RevenueRs 7,028.46 CroreRs 5,406.02 CroreRs 4,562.60 CroreRs 3,931.46 CroreRs 2,504.67 CroreNet ProfitRs 1,075.88 CroreRs 1,057.64 CroreRs 1,103.51 CroreRs 605.05 Crore-Rs 114.50 CroreEPS11.0710.8911.386.25-1.59BVPS96.5086.5176.3164.7958.37ROE11.4612.5714.899.63-2.43Debt to Equity0.270.140.080.120.16Max Healthcare FinancialsMax Healthcare shows significant revenue and profit growth. The company's consolidated revenue for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 3,212.04 Crore, a substantial increase from Rs 1,592.50 Crore in the previous year. The net profit also rose significantly to Rs 1,234.47 Crore. Key financial ratios include a P/E ratio of 18.92 and a P/B ratio of 16.77. Below is a detailed overview of Max Healthcare's financial performance:HeadingMar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023Mar 2022Mar 2021RevenueRs 3,212.04 CroreRs 1,592.50 CroreRs 924.84 CroreRs 743.15 CroreRs 501.37 CroreNet ProfitRs 1,234.47 CroreRs 699.84 CroreRs 156.42 CroreRs 180.75 CroreRs 98.55 CroreEPS96.5556.6616.0618.5130.94BVPS326.84255.24208.86206.26559.09ROE29.9723.578.169.585.81Debt to Equity0.000.000.000.000.00BSE Limited FinancialsBSE Limited has shown substantial revenue and profit increases. The company's consolidated revenue for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 3,212.04 Crore, significantly higher than Rs 1,592.50 Crore in the previous year. The net profit also saw a substantial rise to Rs 1,234.47 Crore. Key financial ratios include a P/E ratio of 18.92 and a P/B ratio of 16.77. Below is a detailed table presenting BSE Limited's financial performance:HeadingMar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023Mar 2022Mar 2021RevenueRs 3,212.04 CroreRs 1,592.50 CroreRs 924.84 CroreRs 743.15 CroreRs 501.37 CroreNet ProfitRs 1,234.47 CroreRs 699.84 CroreRs 156.42 CroreRs 180.75 CroreRs 98.55 CroreEPS96.5556.6616.0618.5130.94BVPS326.84255.24208.86206.26559.09ROE29.9723.578.169.585.81Debt to Equity0.000.000.000.000.00Corporate ActionsVodafone Idea: The company made an announcement regarding investor presentation under Regulation 30 (LODR) on September 10, 2025. Also, the voting results together with Scrutinizer's report for the Annual General Meeting held on August 25, 2025, were enclosed. Additionally, there was a disclosure under Regulation 30(11) of SEBI Listing Regulations-Clarification on news article appearing in Mainstream Media on August 26, 2025. Ola Electric: The company announced the appointment of Mr. Abhishek Jain as Company Secretary & Compliance Officer of the Company with effect from September 12, 2025. There was an exchange regarding details of authorised KMPs to determine materiality event or information and its disclosures to the Stock Exchange on September 12, 2025. A general update regarding creation of pledge on promoter shares was announced on September 10, 2025. Glenmark Pharmaceuticals: Glenmark Pharmaceuticals announced the transfer of the Company's Consumer Care Business on September 15, 2025. Intimation regarding upfront payment received was announced on September 9, 2025. With the stock's last traded price at Rs 7.96, Vodafone Idea has seen a steady decline, making it among the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150.

title: Samvardhana Motherson International shares rise 2.14% in morning trade

At 9:59 am, the stock is a constituent of the Nifty Next 50 index. (x)0.810.800.580.991.11Corporate Actions: Bonus: The company announced a bonus issue on May 29, 2025, with a ratio of 1:2. The ex-bonus date is July 18, 2025. Dividend: Samvardhana Motherson International announced a final dividend of Rs 0.35 per share (35%) with an effective date of June 23, 2025. Earlier, an interim dividend of Rs 0.50 per share (50%) was announced on March 21, 2025, with an effective date of March 28, 2025. Split: The company executed a stock split, where the old face value of Rs 5 was changed to a new face value of Rs 1 on March 16, 2004. Samvardhana Motherson International Limited has informed the exchange regarding schedule of investor meet to be held on September 24, 2025, September 23, 2025 and September 18, 2025. Moneycontrol analysis from September 12, 2025, suggests a bullish sentiment for the stock. With the stock currently trading at Rs 110.12, Samvardhana Motherson International shows a positive trend in today's early trading session.

content: Shares of The Tata Power Company were trading higher at Rs 397 at 9:47 am on Tuesday, a 2.32% increase from the previous close. The stock is a constituent of the NIFTY NEXT 50 index. title: Bharti Airtel shares rise 0.26% in early trade
content: Bharti Airtel shares were trading at Rs 1,909.40 on the NSE, up 0.26% from the previous close, at 9:30 am. Financial Snapshot: The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 49,462.60 Crore, compared to Rs 38,506.40 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 7,339.00 Crore, versus Rs 3,805.80 Crore year-on-year. The company's EPS stood at Rs 10.26 in June 2025, compared to Rs 7.21 in June 2024. Annual Performance: The consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 increased to Rs 172,985.20 Crore from Rs 149,982.40 Crore in March 2024. The net profit significantly increased to Rs 33,778.30 Crore in March 2025 compared to Rs 5,848.60 Crore in March 2024. The EPS also rose to Rs 58.00 in March 2025 from Rs 13.09 in March 2024. title: Larsen & Toubro shares gain 0.69% in early trade
content: Larsen & Toubro shares were trading at Rs 3,610.90 on the NSE, up 0.69% from the previous close, at 9:30 am. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty 50 index. Financial Snapshot: Larsen & Toubro's consolidated financial performance demonstrates steady growth. The company's revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 63,678.92 Crore, up from Rs 55,119.82 Crore in June 2024. Net profit for the same period was Rs 4,325.57 Crore, compared to Rs 3,440.11 Crore in the previous year. The company's annual revenue has consistently increased over the past five years. For the year-ending March 2025, revenue reached Rs 255,734.45 Crore, a significant rise from Rs 135,979.03 Crore in March 2021. The net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 17,687.39 Crore, up from Rs 4,668.96 Crore in March 2021.Financial YearRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)Mar 2021135,979.034,668.9682.49Mar 2022156,521.2310,291.0561.71Mar 2023183,340.7012,624.8774.51Mar 2024221,112.9115,569.7293.96Mar 2025255,734.4517,687.39109.36Larsen & Toubro's revenue increased by 15.66% in 2025 compared to 2024, and the net profit increased by 13.60% during the same period. The EPS also saw an increase from Rs 93.96 in March 2024 to Rs 109.36 in March 2025.QuarterRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)Jun 202455,119.823,440.1120.26Sep 202461,554.584,112.8124.69Dec 202464,667.784,001.0324.43Mar 202574,392.286,133.4439.98Jun 202563,678.924,325.5726.30Corporate Actions: Larsen & Toubro has scheduled analyst/investor meets, including the JP Morgan 10th Annual India Conference, as announced on September 15, 2025. The company also announced that it won a large order in the Bullet Train Project on September 15, 2025. The company announced a final dividend of Rs 34 per share with an effective date of June 3, 2025. Historically, Larsen & Toubro has issued bonus shares, with the most recent bonus issue on July 13, 2017, in the ratio of 1:2. With the stock's last traded price at Rs 3,610.90, Larsen & Toubro shows a marginal gain in the early trading session.

(x)1.751.212.655.997.68Corporate Actions: Cochin Shipyard has announced several corporate actions. On September 15, 2025, there was an announcement regarding a change in management, specifically the appointment to senior management. Additionally, on September 11, 2025, the company announced the appointment of statutory auditors. A public notice to shareholders was issued on September 3, 2025, concerning Rule 20(4)(v) of the Companies (Management and Administration) Rules, 2014. The company has also declared dividends. A final dividend of Rs 2.25 per share (45%) was announced on May 15, 2025, with an effective date of September 12, 2025. Prior to that, an interim dividend of Rs 3.50 per share (70%) was announced on February 6, 2025, effective February 12, 2025. In terms of stock splits, Cochin Shipyard announced a split on November 7, 2023, where the old face value of Rs 10 was split into a new face value of Rs 5. The ex-split and record date was January 10, 2024. Moneycontrol analysis, as of September 12, 2025, indicates a bullish sentiment on the stock. Cochin Shipyard, with its current trading price reflecting positive movement, showcases a strong presence in the market.

title: NLC India shares rise 2.09% in early trade
content: Shares of NLC India were trading at Rs 267.40, up 2.09% in Tuesday's session. At 9:52 am, the stock showed positive movement, trading higher compared to its previous close. NLC India is included as one of the stocks in the Nifty Midcap 150 index.Financial PerformanceNLC India's financial performance shows consistent revenue and profit growth over the past few years. title: Container Corporation of India shares rise 2.06%; stock among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Container Corporation of India's shares gained 2.06% to trade at Rs 567.45 in Tuesday's session. The stock is among the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index, as of 9:51 am.Financial PerformanceHere's a look at the consolidated quarterly and annual financial performance of Container Corporation of India:Consolidated Quarterly FinancialsHeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 2,103.13 CroreRs 2,287.75 CroreRs 2,208.31 CroreRs 2,287.83 CroreRs 2,153.63 CroreNet ProfitRs 260.24 CroreRs 371.25 CroreRs 340.52 CroreRs 287.69 CroreRs 259.13 CroreEPS4.266.016.034.913.51The revenue for Container Corporation of India has fluctuated over the last five quarters, with a high of Rs 2,287.83 Crore in March 2025 and a low of Rs 2,103.13 Crore in June 2024. Net profit also saw variations, peaking at Rs 371.25 Crore in September 2024 and dipping to Rs 259.13 Crore in June 2025.Consolidated Yearly FinancialsHeading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 6,427.08 CroreRs 7,652.73 CroreRs 8,169.12 CroreRs 8,653.41 CroreRs 8,887.02 CroreNet ProfitRs 469.30 CroreRs 1,028.37 CroreRs 1,152.33 CroreRs 1,232.04 CroreRs 1,259.70 CroreEPS8.2217.2719.2620.7121.20BVPS168.90178.18185.92195.74203.19ROE4.959.8110.4510.6610.40Debt to Equity0.010.010.000.000.00The annual revenue has shown a consistent increase from Rs 6,427.08 Crore in 2021 to Rs 8,887.02 Crore in 2025. Similarly, the net profit has risen from Rs 469.30 Crore in 2021 to Rs 1,259.70 Crore in 2025. The Debt to Equity ratio has remained relatively stable at around 0.00-0.01 over the years.Corporate ActionsContainer Corporation of India has announced several corporate actions, including bonus issues and dividends.Bonus Issues:On May 22, 2025, a bonus ratio of 1:4 was announced, with a record date of July 4, 2025, and an ex-bonus date of July 4, 2025.Similar bonus issues of 1:4 were announced on December 20, 2018, and February 13, 2017.Dividends:An interim dividend of Rs 1.60 per share (32%) was announced on August 5, 2025, with an effective date of August 13, 2025.A final dividend of Rs 2.00 per share (40%) was announced on May 22, 2025, with an effective date of June 6, 2025.Additionally, appointments of Statutory Auditors were announced on September 15, 2025, and changes in senior management were announced on September 8, 2025. Container Corporation of India is moved by 2.06.

title: Nifty Top Loser: Asian Paints, Titan Company stocks drag on Nifty 50 index today
content: Shares of Asian Paints and Titan Company were among the top losers on the Nifty 50 in Tuesday's early trading session. At 09:30 am, Asian Paints was trading at Rs 2,489.70, a 0.52% decline from its previous close. Titan Company was trading at Rs 3,516.00, down by 0.51%. Other stocks that experienced losses include TATA Cons. Prod, HDFC Bank, and Shriram Finance. title: Nifty top gainers: Kotak Mahindra, Axis Bank stocks lead on Nifty 50 index today
content: In Tuesday's session, several stocks showed positive momentum, with Kotak Mahindra and Axis Bank leading the gains on the Nifty 50 index. At 9:30 am, Kotak Mahindra was trading at Rs 1,991.00, up by 1.02%. Axis Bank was trading at Rs 1,113.10, a rise of 0.79%. NTPC, Larsen, and Bajaj Finserv also showed positive movement, contributing to the overall positive sentiment in the market. Kotak Mahindra Financial Overview: Kotak Mahindra's financial performance reveals consistent growth over the past few years. Key financial ratios for Kotak Mahindra show a P/E ratio of 19.51 and a P/B ratio of 2.74. The company reported a net interest margin of 4.25% and a return on equity of 14.04% as of the year-ending March 2025. The income statement for Kotak Mahindra shows a steady increase in interest earned, from Rs 32,819 Crore in 2021 to Rs 65,668 Crore in 2025. Total income also increased from Rs 56,814 Crore in 2021 to Rs 106,902 Crore in 2025. The net profit saw a significant increase from Rs 9,903 Crore in 2021 to Rs 21,946 Crore in 2025. Axis Bank Financial Overview: Axis Bank has also demonstrated robust financial performance. Key financial ratios for Axis Bank show a P/E ratio of 12.15 and a P/B ratio of 1.82. The company reported a net interest margin of 3.40% and a return on equity of 14.98% as of the year-ending March 2025. The income statement for Axis Bank shows a steady increase in interest earned, from Rs 64,696 Crore in 2021 to Rs 127,374 Crore in 2025. Total income also increased from Rs 80,847 Crore in 2021 to Rs 155,916 Crore in 2025. The net profit saw a significant increase from Rs 7,252 Crore in 2021 to Rs 28,115 Crore in 2025. NTPC was trading at Rs 333.45, up by 0.71%. Larsen was trading at Rs 3,610.90, a rise of 0.69%. Bajaj Finserv was trading at Rs 2,091.80, up by 0.57%. Among recent corporate actions, Kotak Mahindra announced analyst/investor meets and has a final dividend of Rs 2.50 per share, with an effective date of 18 Jul, 2025. Axis Bank also scheduled analyst/institutional investor meets and has a final dividend of Rs 1.00 per share, effective from 04 Jul, 2025. NTPC declared a final dividend of Rs 3.35 per share, effective 04 Sep, 2025. Larsen & Toubro announced analyst/investor meet. Bajaj Finserv announced approval of the amendment to the Code of Practices and Procedures for Fair Disclosure of Unpublished Price Sensitive Information (UPSI) and has a final dividend of Rs 1.00 per share, effective 27 Jun, 2025. With Kotak Mahindra and Axis Bank leading the gains, the Nifty 50 index is showing a positive trend in the pre-opening session.
summary_lexrank: The income statement for Axis Bank shows a steady increase in interest earned, from Rs 64,696 Crore in 2021 to Rs 127,374 Crore in 2025.
summary_luhn: The income statement for Kotak Mahindra shows a steady increase in interest earned, from Rs 32,819 Crore in 2021 to Rs 65,668 Crore in 2025.
summary_lsa: Axis Bank also scheduled analyst/institutional investor meets and has a final dividend of Rs 1.00 per share, effective from 04 Jul, 2025.
summary_textrank: Bajaj Finserv announced approval of the amendment to the Code of Practices and Procedures for Fair Disclosure of Unpublished Price Sensitive Information (UPSI) and has a final dividend of Rs 1.00 per share, effective 27 Jun, 2025.

title: Top Midcap Gainers: Bharti Hexacom, Balkrishna Ind stocks lead on Nifty Midcap 150 index today
content: Top gainers in the Nifty Midcap 150 index include Bharti Hexacom, Balkrishna Ind, United Brewerie, KPR Mill and HDFC AMC. At 09:30 am, Bharti Hexacom was trading at Rs 1,737.90, a 2.22% gain from its previous close. Balkrishna Ind was trading at Rs 2,454.60, up 2.12%. United Brewerie was trading at Rs 1,829.00, up 1.74%. KPR Mill was trading at Rs 1,062.90, up 1.52% and HDFC AMC was trading at Rs 5,820.00, a 1.32% gain. The company announced a stock split on October 30, 2010, with the old face value of Rs 10 being split into a new face value of Rs 2. The ex-split date was December 20, 2010, and the record date was December 21, 2010. The company has also announced several dividends. The most recent interim dividend was announced on July 18, 2025, for Rs 4.00 per share (200%), with an effective date of July 31, 2025. The stock’s positive movement reflects overall market dynamics. According to a Moneycontrol analysis on September 10, 2025, the sentiment is neutral.

title: United Breweries shares rise 2% in early trade
content: Shares of United Breweries were trading at Rs 1,833.80, up 2% from the previous close, in early trade on Tuesday. On the financial front, United Breweries has demonstrated consistent growth. The consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 8,915.09 Crore, an increase compared to Rs 8,122.68 Crore in the year-ending March 2024. The net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 442.41 Crore, up from Rs 410.86 Crore in the previous year. The company’s quarterly performance also reflects a positive trajectory. The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 2,864.32 Crore, compared to Rs 2,475.13 Crore in the quarter-ending June 2024. The net profit for the same period rose to Rs 184.03 Crore from Rs 173.80 Crore.Jun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 2,475.13 CroreRs 2,116.72 CroreRs 2,000.26 CroreRs 2,322.98 CroreRs The company had previously announced a stock split on April 26, 2006, with an ex-split date of June 9, 2006, and a record date of June 16, 2006. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty Midcap 150 index. Moneycontrol analysis, as of September 16, 2025, indicates a very bearish sentiment for the stock. Shares of United Breweries were trading positively in Tuesday's session.

title: NTPC Green Energy shares rise 2.79% in early trade
content: NTPC Green Energy shares experienced a rise of 2.79% to reach Rs 106.45 in early trading. At 09:18 am, the stock showed positive movement, reflecting early market activity. Financial Snapshot: The following table summarizes the key financial figures for NTPC Green Energy:Heading202320242025RevenueRs 169.69 CroreRs 1,962.60 CroreRs 2,209.64 CroreNet ProfitRs 171.23 CroreRs 344.72 CroreRs 475.35 CroreEPSRs 4.66Rs 0.73Rs 0.67BVPSRs 10.36Rs 10.90Rs 21.88ROE3.505.532.57Debt to Equity1.112.050.97The revenue for NTPC Green Energy has shown significant growth from Rs 169.69 Crore in 2023 to Rs 2,209.64 Crore in 2025. Similarly, the net profit has increased from Rs 171.23 Crore in 2023 to Rs 475.35 Crore in 2025. However, the EPS has decreased from Rs 4.66 in 2023 to Rs 0.67 in 2025. title: Dalmia Bharat share price hits 52-week high at Rs 2,450, up 0.46%
content: Dalmia Bharat shares reached a 52-week high of Rs 2,450 on the NSE, marking a 0.46% increase from its previous close, during Tuesday's trading session. title: Balmer Lawrie stock turns ex-dividend today; investors eye Rs 8.5 per share payout
content: Balmer Lawrie & Co. announced a final dividend of ₹8.50 per share. The ex-date for this dividend is today, September 16, 2025. Investors who owned the stock before today will be eligible for the dividend payout. The company's stock last traded at ₹235.50, reflecting a 1.74% increase compared to its previous closing price. The company has a market capitalization of 4,027 Crore.Dividend DetailsParticularsDetailsDividend per share₹8.50Ex-DateSeptember 16, 2025Financial Performance Overview: Balmer Lawrie's financial performance reveals consistent revenue and profit generation. The consolidated revenue for the year ending March 2025 stood at ₹2,515.64 Crore, a notable increase from ₹2,339.23 Crore in the previous year. Net profit for the same period was ₹194.82 Crore, slightly lower than the ₹199.31 Crore reported in the year prior. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) increased from ₹15.30 to ₹15.55. Quarterly, the company's revenue reached ₹680.66 Crore in June 2025, up from ₹608.16 Crore in March 2025. The net profit for the June 2025 quarter was ₹51.98 Crore, compared to ₹58.78 Crore in the previous quarter.Key Financial Metrics (Consolidated)MetricYear Ending Mar 2025 (₹ Crore)Year Ending Mar 2024 (₹ Crore)YoY Change (%)Quarter Ending Jun 2025 (₹ Crore)Quarter Ending Mar 2025 (₹ Crore)Revenue2,515.642,339.23+7.55%680.66608.16Net Profit194.82199.31-2.25%51.9858.78EPS15.5515.30+1.63%4.034.39Annual Income Statement Highlights: The company's annual income statement for the year ending March 2025 shows sales of ₹2,515 Crore, up from ₹2,339 Crore in the previous year. Total income increased to ₹2,565 Crore from ₹2,390 Crore. Total expenditure also rose to ₹2,263 Crore from ₹2,093 Crore, resulting in an EBIT of ₹302 Crore, compared to ₹296 Crore in the prior year. Net profit stood at ₹194 Crore, slightly below the previous year's ₹199 Crore. Quarterly Income Statement Highlights: For the quarter ending June 2025, sales reached ₹680 Crore, up from ₹608 Crore in the previous quarter. Total income was ₹690 Crore, and total expenditure was ₹611 Crore, leading to an EBIT of ₹78 Crore. The net profit for the quarter was ₹51 Crore. Balance Sheet Snapshot: The company's balance sheet indicates a strong financial position. As of March 2025, total equities and liabilities amounted to ₹3,039 Crore, with share capital remaining constant at ₹171 Crore. Reserves and surplus increased to ₹1,797 Crore from ₹1,649 Crore. Total assets also stood at ₹3,039 Crore, with fixed assets at ₹804 Crore and current assets at ₹1,580 Crore. Cash Flow Analysis: Cash flow from operating activities was ₹156 Crore, while investing activities generated ₹22 Crore and financing activities resulted in an outflow of ₹188 Crore. The net cash flow for the year was a decrease of ₹9 Crore. Key Ratios: Key financial ratios reveal insights into the company's performance. The Basic EPS for March 2025 was ₹15.55, up from ₹15.30 in the previous year. The Book Value per Share increased to ₹115.12 from ₹108.06. Return on Networth/Equity stood at 13.50%, slightly lower than the 14.36% in the previous year. The Debt to Equity ratio remained stable at 0.04. The last value of Balmer Lawrie's stock was ₹235.50, with a gain of 1.74% yesterday.

title: One Mobikwik AGM due today; shares gain 6% on Monday ahead of the meet
content: One Mobikwik shares rose by nearly 6% to end at Rs 314.7 on Monday, ahead of its Annual General Meeting (AGM). The AGM's ex-date is due today, September 16, 2025. The company's market capitalization stands at Rs 2,459 crore. One Mobikwik, which got listed on the stock exchanges in December 2024, is a constituent of the Nifty IPO index. The stock demonstrated a positive movement compared to the previous day's closing price, reflecting investor interest surrounding the upcoming AGM. Financial Performance Overview: One Mobikwik's financial performance reveals a mixed trend. The consolidated revenue for the year ending March 2025 reached Rs 1,170.17 crore, a notable increase from Rs 875.00 crore in the previous year. However, the company reported a net loss of Rs 121.53 crore for the same period, a downturn compared to the net profit of Rs 14.08 crore in the year prior. Examining the quarterly results, the company's revenue for June 2025 stood at Rs 271.36 crore, while the net loss amounted to Rs 41.92 crore. These figures provide insights into the company's recent operational dynamics.Key Financial Metrics (Consolidated)MetricMar 2025 (₹ Cr)Mar 2024 (₹ Cr)Mar 2023 (₹ Cr)Revenue1,170.17875.00539.47Net Profit-121.5314.08-83.81EPS-19.272.46-14.66BVPS75.7728.4324.95ROE (%)-20.648.65-58.73Debt to Equity0.461.301.35Quarterly Performance:Quarterly Financials (₹ Cr)MetricJun 2025Mar 2025Dec 2024Sep 2024Jun 2024Revenue271.36267.78269.48290.65342.27Net Profit-41.92-56.04-55.28-3.59-6.62EPS-5.39-8.88-9.48-0.63-1.16Balance Sheet Highlights:Balance Sheet (Consolidated - ₹ Cr)ParticularsMar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023Share Capital151111Reserves & Surplus5739278Current Liabilities753638535Total Liabilities1,360854714Fixed Assets251514Current Assets1,198690550Total Assets1,360854714Total liabilities of One Mobikwik stood at Rs 1,360 crore as of March 2025, compared to total assets of Rs 1,360 crore. Current assets were Rs 1,198 crore, and current liabilities were Rs 753 crore, indicating a current ratio of 1.59. The One Mobikwik's AGM, coupled with its recent financial performance, is likely to be a key topic of discussion among investors and stakeholders.

title: RITES final dividend ex-date due tomorrow, investors to get Rs 2.65 per share; last day today to trade
content: RITES announced a final dividend of ₹2.65 per share, with the ex-date due tomorrow, September 17, 2025. This makes today the last day to trade the stock before it turns ex-dividend; investors who own the stock today will be eligible for the dividend payout. RITES' shares last traded at ₹275.14, marking a 2.70% increase compared to the previous day's closing price. This dividend announcement follows a period of fluctuating financial performance for the company. RITES, a transport infrastructure consultancy and engineering firm, has a market capitalization of approximately ₹13,223.33 crore. The dividend payout reflects the company's commitment to rewarding shareholders amidst evolving financial dynamics.Dividend DetailsParticularsDetailsDividend per share₹2.65Ex-DateSeptember 17, 2025The company's recent financial performance reveals some key trends. Consolidated revenue for the quarter ending June 2025 stood at ₹489.74 crore, slightly up from ₹485.76 crore in June 2024. However, it is lower compared to the revenue figures from subsequent quarters of the previous fiscal year, with ₹540.86 crore in September 2024, ₹575.76 crore in December 2024, and ₹615.43 crore in March 2025. Net profit for the quarter ending June 2025 was ₹88.52 crore, a marginal increase from ₹88.27 crore in June 2024. The net profit peaked at ₹137.63 crore in March 2025. Earnings per share (EPS) for June 2025 were reported at ₹1.67. Looking at the yearly performance, the company's revenue has seen a decline over the past five years. The revenue for the year 2025 was ₹2,217.81 crore, compared to ₹2,452.85 crore in 2024, ₹2,628.27 crore in 2023, ₹2,661.83 crore in 2022, and ₹1,859.54 crore in 2021. The net profit also showed a similar downward trend, with ₹411.43 crore in 2025, ₹489.73 crore in 2024, ₹570.00 crore in 2023, ₹537.86 crore in 2022, and ₹443.14 crore in 2021. The EPS for 2025 stood at ₹8.01, significantly lower than the previous years. Key financial ratios indicate a changing landscape. The book value per share (BVPS) for 2025 was ₹54.93, a notable decrease from ₹113.23 in 2024. The return on equity (ROE) was 16.04% in 2025. The company maintains a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.00, indicating a low level of debt. RITES' announcement of a final dividend, coupled with its current market performance and underlying financial data, presents a mixed picture for investors. While the dividend provides an immediate return, the declining revenue and profit trends warrant a closer examination of the company's strategic direction and operational efficiencies.

title: HCL Infosystems AGM due tomorrow; shares fall by 3.43% in Monday's session
content: HCL Infosystem's Annual General Meeting (AGM) is due tomorrow, September 17, 2025. The company's shares experienced a decline of 3.43% on Monday, with the last traded price at Rs 15.49. Financial Performance: HCL Info has demonstrated fluctuating financial performance over the past year. Analyzing the quarterly results, the revenue figures show variation, with June 2024 reporting Rs 7.47 crore, decreasing to Rs 6.79 crore in September 2024, Rs 5.70 crore in December 2024, and further down to Rs 4.65 crore in March 2025. However, there was a slight recovery in June 2025 with revenue reaching Rs 7.03 crore. The net profit figures have consistently remained negative, with losses of Rs 4.13 crore in June 2024, which deepened to Rs 7.84 crore by September 2024, then improved slightly to losses of Rs 5.25 crore and Rs 3.90 crore in December 2024 and March 2025 respectively, before rising again to Rs 4.50 crore in June 2025. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) mirrors this trend, ranging from -Rs 0.12 to -Rs 0.24 across the quarters.Quarterly Financial Performance (in ₹ crore)MetricJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025Revenue7.47 Cr6.79 Cr5.70 Cr4.65 Cr7.03 CrNet Profit-4.13 Cr-7.84 Cr-5.25 Cr-3.90 Cr-4.50 CrEPS-0.13-0.24-0.16-0.12-0.14Yearly data reveals a concerning trend in revenue. From Rs 352.75 crore in 2021, revenue significantly dropped to Rs 69.44 crore in 2022, and further to Rs 31.41 crore in 2023 and Rs 32.17 crore in 2024. The latest figure for 2025 shows a decline to Rs 24.61 crore. Net profit has also been inconsistent, with a substantial loss of Rs 196.73 crore in 2021, followed by a profit of Rs 24.52 crore in 2022, but then losses of Rs 38.79 crore in 2023, Rs 15.87 crore in 2024 and Rs 21.11 crore in 2025. title: KRBL dividend ex-date due tomorrow, investors to get Rs 3.5 per share payout; last day to trade today
content: KRBL announced a final dividend of ₹3.50 per share, with the ex-date due tomorrow, September 17, 2025. KRBL stock's last traded price was ₹401.45, reflecting a decline of 9.60% from its previous close. This announcement follows a period of fluctuating financial performance, which will be detailed below. KRBL, with a market capitalization of 9188.78 Crore, has consistently rewarded its shareholders with dividends. This final dividend announcement adds to the company's track record of distributing profits. The ex-date being tomorrow means that investors must own the shares before this date to be eligible for the dividend, or must sell today before the stock turns ex-dividend. Dividend DetailsThe final dividend of ₹3.50 per share represents a notable distribution to shareholders. Shareholders should note that the ex-date is a critical factor in determining eligibility for this dividend.Dividend DetailsParticularsDetailsDividend per share₹3.50Ex-DateSeptember 17, 2025Financial Performance OverviewKRBL's financial performance over the past year shows a mixed trend. The company’s revenue has seen growth, but net profit has experienced a decline. Examining both quarterly and yearly results provides a comprehensive view. The consolidated revenue for the year ending March 2025 was ₹5,593.81 crore, compared to ₹5,384.69 crore in the previous year. However, the net profit for the same period decreased to ₹476.05 crore from ₹595.86 crore. This decrease in net profit is also reflected in the EPS, which fell from ₹25.69 to ₹20.80. On a quarterly basis, the company reported revenue of ₹1,584.35 crore for the quarter ending June 2025, up from ₹1,199.18 crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same quarter was ₹150.58 crore, compared to ₹86.56 crore in the previous year. title: Eternal-Zomato shares among top Nifty gainers on Monday, rise 0.6%
content: Eternal (Zomato) stock was among the top gainers on the Nifty 50 in Monday's trading session. The stock ended at Rs 323.30 yesterday, up 0.59% from the previous close. Eternal stock is a constituent of benchmark Nifty 50 index. Financial Highlights Eternal's financial performance shows the following trends based on consolidated results:Revenue: The company's revenue has increased consistently over the past five years. Annual revenue rose from Rs 1,993.79 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 20,243.00 Crore in March 2025. In the quarter-ending June 2025, the company's revenue stood at Rs 7,167.00 Crore, up from Rs 4,206.00 Crore in June 2024.Net Profit: The company has turned profitable in recent years. The net profit was Rs 527.00 Crore for the year-ending March 2025, compared to a net loss of Rs -816.43 Crore in March 2021. However, the net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 25.00 Crore, down from Rs 253.00 Crore in June 2024.EPS: The company's Earnings Per Share (EPS) has improved from negative values to positive. The EPS was Rs 0.60 for the year-ending March 2025, compared to Rs -1.51 in March 2021. For the quarter-ending June 2025, EPS was Rs 0.03, down from Rs 0.29 in June 2024.Balance Sheet Key figures from the company's balance sheet are:Share Capital: Increased from Rs 0 in March 2021 to Rs 907 Crore in March 2025.Reserves & Surplus: Increased from Rs 7,643 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 29,410 Crore in March 2025.Total Liabilities: Increased from Rs 8,703 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 35,623 Crore in March 2025.Fixed Assets: Increased from Rs 291 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 3,846 Crore in March 2025.Total Assets: Increased from Rs 8,703 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 35,623 Crore in March 2025.Cash Flow The company's cash flow from operating activities was Rs 308 Crore in March 2025, compared to Rs -1,017 Crore in March 2021. Financial Ratios Important financial ratios as of March 2025 include:Basic EPS: Rs 0.60Book Value / Share: Rs 33.43Return on Networth / Equity: 1.73%Debt to Equity: 0.00Current Ratio: 3.52The company’s P/E ratio stands at 336.17 and P/B ratio is 6.03. Corporate Actions Eternal Limited has been actively updating the exchanges regarding various corporate actions. On August 25, 2025, the company informed the exchange about receiving three orders from the Joint Commissioner, Appeals-4, Bengaluru. Additionally, on August 21, 2025, Eternal Limited announced the incorporation of Blinkit Foods Limited as a wholly-owned subsidiary. The company also submitted the scrutinizers' report and voting results of the 15th Annual General Meeting held on August 19, 2025, to the exchange. Moneycontrol analysis, as of September 12, 2025, indicates a bullish sentiment on Eternal's stock.

title: Asian Paints shares fall 1.72% on Monday, among top losers on Nifty 50
content: Shares of Asian Paints declined 1.72% on Monday, with the stock ending at Rs 2,502.60. The decline positioned the stock among the top losers on the Nifty 50 in yesterday's trading session. Asian Paints stock is a constituent of the Nifty 50 index. Financial Performance: The following table summarizes the consolidated quarterly financial performance of Asian Paints:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 8,969.73 CroreRs 8,027.54 CroreRs 8,549.44 CroreRs 8,358.91 CroreRs 8,938.55 CroreNet ProfitRs 1,150.07 CroreRs 662.54 CroreRs 1,078.61 CroreRs 677.78 CroreRs 1,080.73 CroreEPS12.207.2511.587.2211.47The revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 8,938.55 Crore, slightly lower compared to Rs 8,969.73 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same period stood at Rs 1,080.73 Crore, while the EPS was Rs 11.47. title: Transrail Lighting shares gain on orders win of Rs 421 crore in Africa
content: Transrail Lighting share price gained in the opening trade on September 16 following transmission line contract win in Africa. At 09:18am, Transrail Lighting was quoting at Rs 808.55, up Rs 9.15, or 1.14 percent, on the BSE. "... has bagged new orders of Rs 421 crore, including a large transmission line contract in a new country in Africa," company said in its release. These additions have taken the FY26 order inflows beyond Rs 3,500 crore as of August 2025, reflecting a growth of 78 percent YoY.

title: First Tick: Top global cues to watch in today’s trade
content: Indian benchmark indices Sensex and Nifty are likely to see a flat to negative start today, tracking GIFT Nifty, which was hovering around 25,153.00. Track the latest updates on GIFT Nifty right here on Moneycontrol. Market witnessed rangebound activity with Nifty hovering around 25,100 level throughout the session on September 15, to end with marginal losses below 25,100. At close, the Sensex was down 118.96 points or 0.15 percent at 81,785.74, and the Nifty was down 44.80 points or 0.18 percent at 25,069.20. BSE Midcap index up 0.4 percent and smallcap index up 0.7 percent. Here is how financial markets across the globe fared overnight: GIFT Nifty (Down) The GIFT Nifty is trading lower at around 25,153, indicating a flat to negative start for the day. Asian Equities (Mixed) Asian stocks posted modest gains at the open after Wall Street hit fresh highs ahead of an expected Federal Reserve interest-rate cut this week. US Equities (Up) The three major U.S. stock indexes closed higher on Monday with the S&P 500 and the Nasdaq notching intraday record high closes, as investors await the Federal Reserve's crucial policy meeting later this week. The Dow Jones Industrial Average rose 49.23 points, or 0.11%, to 45,883.45, the S&P 500 gained 30.99 points, or 0.47%, to 6,615.28 and the Nasdaq Composite gained 207.65 points, or 0.94%, to 22,348.75. US Bond Yield (Down) The yield on 10-year Treasuries were down marginally at 4.03%, while 2-year Treasuries were down marginally at 3.53%. Dollar Index (Flat) The dollar index steadied around 97.35 against the other major currencies after sliding in the priorsession. Asian currencies (Mixed) Asian currencies were trading mixed against in the early trade today with Taiwan Dollar, Singapore Dollar, Philippines Peso were trading higher. Crude (Gains) Oil prices held steady in early trade on Tuesday after rising in the previous session, as market participants contemplated potential supply disruption from Russia after Ukrainian drone attacks on its refineries. Gold (Up) Gold held its gains after rising to a new record, while Silver prices also trading flat. Fund Flow Action The Foreign institutional investors (FIIs) sold equities worth Rs 1268 crore on September 15, while Domestic institutional investors (DIIs) bought equities worth Rs 1933 crore on the same day. Hope you're all set for today's trade. We wish you a profitable day ahead. title: Asian stocks gain at open after Wall Street rally
content: Asian stocks posted modest gains at the open after Wall Street hit fresh highs ahead of an expected Federal Reserve interest-rate cut this week. Shares in Japan, Australia and South Korea opened higher, with the MSCI Asia-Pacific Index hovering near its record high. S&P 500 contracts were steady, as a $14 trillion record-breaking run in US equities headed for an inflection point, with the expected rate cut set to dominate a week that will shape policy for half of the world’s 10 most-traded currencies. Bets on Fed easing sent the S&P 500 above 6,600 on Monday, while the Nasdaq 100 posted its longest advance since 2023. Also aiding sentiment was a framework deal to keep TikTok running in the US, with President Donald Trump saying he’d talk to China’s Xi Jinping on Friday. A gauge of the dollar steadied after sliding in the prior session. Gold held its gains after rising to a new record. Signs of labor-market weakening and no major inflation surprises have sealed the deal for what money markets project will be a quarter-point Fed cut in September. The big question, though, will be the pace of easing after that, with prices stubbornly above the central bank’s 2% target. “Now the discussion will turn to how aggressively the Fed will act,” said Chris Larkin at E*Trade from Morgan Stanley. “The Fed may remind everyone that it may be focused on jobs now, but it hasn’t forgotten about the other half of its mandate.” In other Fed news, a US appeals court blocked the president from removing Governor Lisa Cook from her post while her lawsuit challenging the dismissal proceeds. Also, Trump’s economic adviser Stephen Miran is on his way to joining the central bank’s board after the Senate confirmed him to the post. On Wednesday, US policymakers will also release their quarterly update of economic and rate forecasts — known as the dot plot — and Fed Chair Jerome Powell will hold his regular post-decision press conference. In June, Fed officials were narrowly in favor of two quarter-point cuts in 2025. What traders will really hang on to is the tone of Powell’s press conference and the “dot plot” projections, according to Fawad Razaqzada at City Index and Forex.com. “I’ll be watching how the market reacts to any mention of inflation being ‘well anchored’ or the labor market ‘cooling more than expected’,” he said. “That sort of language would be music to the ears of dollar bears. On the flip side, a cautious Fed that hints at a ‘wait and see’ approach might stall the rally, at least temporarily.” Separately, JPMorgan Chase & Co. will cut the weight of the largest bond issuers in its flagship emerging-market index, diverting investor flows from the likes of China and India toward smaller nations.
summary_lexrank: Also, Trump’s economic adviser Stephen Miran is on his way to joining the central bank’s board after the Senate confirmed him to the post.
summary_luhn: S&P 500 contracts were steady, as a $14 trillion record-breaking run in US equities headed for an inflection point, with the expected rate cut set to dominate a week that will shape policy for half of the world’s 10 most-traded currencies.
summary_lsa: Signs of labor-market weakening and no major inflation surprises have sealed the deal for what money markets project will be a quarter-point Fed cut in September.
summary_textrank: On the flip side, a cautious Fed that hints at a ‘wait and see’ approach might stall the rally, at least temporarily.” Separately, JPMorgan Chase & Co. will cut the weight of the largest bond issuers in its flagship emerging-market index, diverting investor flows from the likes of China and India toward smaller nations.

title: Trade Spotlight: How should you trade Cochin Shipyard, Olectra, Sarda Energy, Lupin, Siemens, NBCC, Nava, Aditya Birla Real Estate, and others on September 16?
content: The benchmark indices closed moderately lower, with the Nifty 50 snapping its eight-day winning streak on September 15, but the market breadth was positive. A total of 1,539 shares advanced compared to 1,283 declining shares on the NSE. The market may remain consolidative with rangebound trading until the August high is decisively broken. Below are some short-term trading ideas to consider: Jigar S Patel, Senior Manager - Equity Research at Anand Rathi Cochin Shipyard | CMP: Rs 1,807.8 Cochin Shipyard has established a strong technical base with a triple-bottom pattern in the Rs 1,650–1,700 zone, reinforcing investor confidence at lower levels. The stock has now given a trendline breakout, further validated by a bullish divergence on the MACD histogram, signaling a likely shift in momentum. Adding to the positive setup, the price has managed to close above the R4 Camarilla monthly pivot—a crucial breakout level—indicating strength in the current trend. Traders may consider entering long positions in the Rs 1,820–1,780 zone, with an upside target of Rs 2,100. Strategy: Buy Target: Rs 2,100 Stop-Loss: Rs 1,650 ITI | CMP: Rs 322.55 ITI is showing encouraging signs of strength after successfully holding near its previous demand and breakout zone, reinforcing a solid support base. The stock has recently managed to close marginally above the monthly pivot, a breakout level that often signals continuation of an uptrend. On shorter timeframes, hourly charts are reflecting bullish divergence, further validating the possibility of momentum picking up in the near term. This confluence of technical indicators suggests an attractive risk-reward setup. Traders may consider entering long positions in the Rs 325–315 zone, with an upside target of Rs 380. Strategy: Buy Target: Rs 380 Stop-Loss: Rs 290 Aditya Birla Real Estate | CMP: Rs 1,866.2 A strong base formation is observed in the Rs 1,780–1,830 zone, providing a solid support area for Aditya Birla Real Estate. This zone also coincides with a previously established demand zone, reinforcing its significance. Recently, a trendline breakout has been witnessed around this region, supported by a positive signal on the MACD histogram, which indicates a shift in momentum. Such technical alignment between base formation, demand zone support, and momentum breakout strengthens the case for potential upside. As long as prices hold above the Rs 1,780–1,830 zone, the outlook remains constructive, with scope for a sustained move higher in the near term. Traders may consider entering long positions in the Rs 1,840–1,870 zone, with a target of Rs 2,050. Strategy: Buy Target: Rs 2,050 Stop-Loss: Rs 1,755 Vidnyan S Sawant, Head of Research at GEPL Capital NBCC India | CMP: Rs 107.66 NBCC has witnessed a breakout from a flag and pole chart pattern in the prior week, signaling a potential bullish continuation. Additionally, the stock has shown a mean reversion from the 50-week EMA, which aligns with the 50% Fibonacci retracement level, indicating strong buying interest at key technical support. On the momentum front, the RSI has exhibited a bullish divergence, and the positive crossover further reinforces the likelihood of a trend reversal, suggesting building upward momentum. Strategy: Buy Target: Rs 121 Stop-Loss: Rs 102 Olectra Greentech | CMP: Rs 1,647.4 Olectra Greentech has shown positive price action across multiple timeframes, reflecting sustained bullish momentum. On the monthly chart, the stock is forming a higher top–higher bottom structure, indicating a strong uptrend. On the weekly timeframe, the stock found support near the 61.8% Fibonacci retracement level, from where it has resumed its upward trajectory—signaling renewed buying interest and bullish sentiment. Furthermore, the RSI remains above 60, reinforcing the view of sustained positive momentum in the stock. Strategy: Buy Target: Rs 1,877 Stop-Loss: Rs 1,560 Nava | CMP: Rs 705 Nava has been in a sustained uptrend since the 2020 bottom, and recent price action suggests continued strength. On the monthly chart, the stock formed a base near its 12-month EMA, and the breakout in August indicates a robust price structure with the potential for further upside. On the weekly timeframe, the stock is trading firmly above key moving averages—namely the 5-, 12-, and 26-week EMAs—signaling strong trend alignment. Additionally, the RSI is holding near 70, highlighting solid momentum and sustained bullish sentiment. Strategy: Buy Target: Rs 775 Stop-Loss: Rs 675 Sarda Energy & Minderals | CMP: Rs 626.15 Sarda Energy continues to remain in a strong uptrend on the monthly chart. In August, the stock broke out of a 10-month consolidation zone, signaling a shift in momentum. The current month reflects continued buying interest, further validating the breakout. The stock is now trading at all-time highs, indicating robust bullish momentum. Additionally, the presence of a bullish divergence adds strength to the overall positive outlook. Strategy: Buy Target: Rs 725 Stop-Loss: Rs 595 Jay Thakkar, Vice President & Head of Derivatives and Quant Research at ICICI Securities Lupin | CMP: Rs 2,046 Lupin has provided a breakout from the falling trendline, with short-covering data in its futures segment clearly indicating a short-term trend reversal from down to up. There has been clear Call unwinding at the Rs 2,040 and Rs 2,100 strikes, which is positive, and there have been aggressive Put additions as well, indicating support at lower levels. The stock is trading well above its maximum pain level of Rs 2,000, indicating that the short-term trend is positive. Buy Lupin Futures in the range of Rs 2,030–2,050. Strategy: Buy Target: Rs 2,130, Rs 2,160 Stop-Loss: Rs 1,980 Siemens | CMP: Rs 3,293.7 Siemens has provided a breakout and a close above the symmetrical triangular pattern, with short-covering data in the futures segment, which is a positive sign in the near term. There were significant shorts in the stock, and with the short-term trend reversal in the price, further short covering can’t be ruled out. The options data suggests that above the Rs 3,300 strike, there will be additional short covering, as it has the highest Call base. Beyond these levels, there will likely be even more short covering. The stock has closed well above its maximum pain level of Rs 3,200; hence, there is good support at lower levels. Buy Siemens Futures in the range of Rs 3,300–3,320. Strategy: Buy Target: Rs 3,420, Rs 3,500 Stop-Loss: Rs 3,230 Reliance Industries | CMP: Rs 1,399.3 Reliance Industries has provided a breakout from the falling trendline, with short-covering data in the futures segment, which is a positive trend reversal sign in the near term. The stock has closed at Rs 1,400 levels, which has the highest Call base; hence, this is also positive in the near term. There has been considerable Call unwinding from the Rs 1,360 to Rs 1,400 strikes, as well as Put additions at the Rs 1,400 strike, indicating support at lower levels. So, there is a higher probability of further short covering in the near term. Buy Reliance Futures in the range of Rs 1,400–1,405. title: Stocks to Watch Today: Transrail Lighting, NCC, Adani Enterprises, Sanghvi Movers, Asahi India, John Cockerill, JSW Infra, Bajaj Finserv in focus on 16 September
content: Let's catch up on the latest news from the stock market. From significant investments to major deals, order wins, quarterly earnings, and appointments, here’s a quick look at which stocks will be in focus in today's trade: Results Today Mangal Electrical Industries Quarterly Earnings Patel Retail Q1 (YoY) Profit grows 13.2% to Rs 6.9 crore Vs Rs 6.1 crore Revenue increases 2.86% to Rs 182.5 crore Vs Rs 177.4 crore Stocks to Watch Wipro The IT services company announced an expanded partnership with CrowdStrike to launch Wipro CyberShield MDR, an AI-powered unified managed security service (MSS) that simplifies and strengthens enterprise security operations. Transrail Lighting The EPC company has secured new orders worth Rs 421 crore, including a large transmission line contract in a new African country. These additions have taken the company’s FY26 order inflows beyond Rs 3,500 crore as of August 2025, reflecting a 78% YoY growth. NCC The company has received a contract worth Rs 2,090.5 crore from the Water Resources Department, Bihar, for the construction of the Barnar reservoir, dam structures, irrigation channels, and other associated works in Jamui district. Adani Enterprises The company has received a Letter of Award (LoA) from the National Highways Logistics Management (NHLML) for building the ropeway project connecting Sonprayag with Kedarnath. The company will invest Rs 4,081 crore in its first ropeway project between Sonprayag and Kedarnath. Sanghvi Movers Sangreen Future Renewable, a material subsidiary of Sanghvi Movers, has received large work orders worth Rs 292 crore from prominent independent power producers (IPPs). Mishra Dhatu Nigam The company has secured an order worth Rs 136 crore. With this, MIDHANI's total order book now stands at Rs 1,983 crore as of the latest date. John Cockerill India The company has received a contract from Tata Steel for the engineering, design, manufacture, and supply of Pickling and ARP plants to be installed at the Jamshedpur (Tinplate Division), Jharkhand. The total contract value is around Rs 80 crore, which includes supervision of erection and commissioning. Additionally, the company has appointed Ujwal Kawale as Chief Operating Officer, effective September 15. IndusInd Bank CRED has launched a new credit card program with rewards across all e-commerce platforms, and instant, flexible redemption options on flights, hotels, hundreds of merchants, and thousands of products. The first launch under this program is the CRED IndusInd Bank RuPay credit card. Additionally, Charu Sachdeva Mathur has resigned as Head - Digital Banking & Strategy (Existing Business) and Senior Management Personnel of the bank to pursue opportunities outside the organization. Crompton Greaves Consumer Electricals The Board has approved the appointment of Sundaram Damodarannair as Chairman of the company, in the capacity of Non-Executive, Non-Independent Director, effective September 18. Asahi India Glass The company has opened its Qualified Institutional Placement (QIP) issue for fundraising on September 15. The floor price has been fixed at Rs 844.79 per share. Zydus Lifesciences ZyVet Animal Health, a wholly owned subsidiary of Zydus Pharmaceuticals (USA) Inc, has launched the first FDA-approved generic of phenylpropanolamine hydrochloride tablets, used for managing urinary incontinence in dogs. Additionally, ZyVet has announced the launch of the first veterinary-approved generic of Furosemide tablets, a critical therapy for managing congestive heart failure and chronic fluid retention in dogs and cats. Wendt (India) Ninad Gadgil has resigned as Executive Director & Chief Executive Officer of the company, effective September 15. Canara Bank The bank’s subsidiary, Canara HSBC Life Insurance Company, has received approval from SEBI for its Draft Red Herring Prospectus (DRHP), allowing it to file an Updated RHP for its upcoming IPO. Aksharchem India The company has announced a planned shutdown of its green plant at Indrad, Mahesana, effective September 15, for repair and maintenance. The shutdown is expected to last up to three weeks. Maruti Suzuki India The company has announced introductory prices for the all-new VICTORIS, starting at Rs 10,49,900. Sales will commence from September 22. Kaya The Board will meet on September 18 to consider various fund-raising options. JSW Infrastructure The company’s subsidiary, JSW Kolkata Container, has entered into a concession agreement with the Port Authority for a period of 30 years from the date of award. In July, it had received a Letter of Award for reconstruction of Berth-8 and mechanization of Berth-7 and Berth-8 at Netaji Subhash Dock, part of the Kolkata Dock System, under Syama Prasad Mookerjee Port Authority, via PPP mode. AGI Greenpac The company is undertaking two de-bottlenecking exercises to revamp its container glass facility from 1,850 TPD to 1,900 TPD, and to enhance its speciality glass facility from 154 TPD to 200 TPD, at an estimated capital expenditure of Rs 47 crore. The increased capacity is expected to be operational by March 2026. Bajaj Finserv In a major legal win for Bajaj Allianz General Insurance Company, the Bombay High Court has quashed a Rs 374 crore claim made by the Government of Maharashtra. According to CNBC-TV18, the Court ruled that the demand was ‘unsustainable’ and stands dismissed. Bajaj Allianz General Insurance is a subsidiary of the listed entity Bajaj Finserv. Lloyds Engineering Works The company has entered into an agreement with CEMI Process Optimization Brazil and CEMI Process Optimization LLC to promote and sell CEMI’s products and services, including software solutions and specialized equipment for process optimization, in the Indian market. Tega Industries The Board will meet on September 18 to consider raising funds via the issue of equity shares on a preferential basis. Bulk, Block Deals Laxmi Dental Abu Dhabi Investment Authority (ADIA) sold 5.58 lakh shares each in Laxmi Dental at Rs 303.01 and Rs 303 per share, amounting to a 2.03% stake valued at Rs 33.82 crore. As of June 2025, ADIA held a 3.18% stake in the company. Meanwhile, ICICI Prudential MF acquired 8,62,523 shares at Rs 303 per share, and 7,38,436 shares also at Rs 303 per share, totaling a 2.91% stake worth Rs 48.5 crore. Resourceful Automobile Plutus Capital Management purchased 31,200 shares in Resourceful Automobile at Rs 62.85 per share, whereas Rajat Verma offloaded 32,400 shares at Rs 63.07 per share. Godawari Power and Ispat Amrita Kedia and Anand Poddar acquired 32.5 lakh shares in the company at Rs 242 per share from Ardent Steel, in a deal valued at Rs 78.65 crore. title: Abu Dhabi Investment Authority sells 2% stake in Laxmi Dental, ICICI Prudential MF buys 2.91% shares
content: Abu Dhabi Investment Authority, the global investor on behalf of the Government of Abu Dhabi, sold 2.03 percent stake in Laxmi Dental, the dental products company via open market transactions on September 15. Laxmi Dental shares corrected 0.83 percent to Rs 303.40 on Monday, extending its downtrend for fifth consecutive session. It has dropped more than Rs 200 from July high of Rs 510. Abu Dhabi Investment Authority (ADIA) sold 5.58 lakh shares each in Laxmi Dental at Rs 303.01 per share, and Rs 303 per share, respectively, which is equivalent to 2.03 percent stake valued at Rs 33.82 crore. As of June 2025, ADIA had held 3.18 percent stake in the company. However, ICICI Prudential MF acquired 8,62,523 shares at Rs 303 per share, and 7,38,436 shares at Rs 303 per share in the dental products company, which totalled to 2.91 percent stake worth Rs 48.5 crore. NV Alpha Fund Management acquired 26 lakh shares in Rushil Decor at Rs 32 per share, however, Sajjan Bhajanka sold 16.83 lakh shares at same price. Plutus Capital Management purchased 31,200 shares in Resourceful Automobile at Rs 62.85 per share, whereas Rajat Verma offloaded 32,400 shares at Rs 63.07 per share. Meanwhile, Godawari Power and Ispat shares saw huge buying interest on Monday, rising 10.68 percent to Rs 270.15, may be after block deals. Amrita Kedia, and Anand Poddar acquired 32.5 lakh shares in the company at Rs 242 per share from Ardent Steel, which valued at Rs 78.65 crore.
