title: Hindustan Unilever share price declines 0.25%, hits intraday low of Rs 2,572.90
content: Shares of Hindustan Unilever were trading at Rs 2,574.10, a decline of 0.25% from the previous close, at 10:30 am on Monday. The stock touched a day's high of Rs 2,589.00 and a day's low of Rs 2,572.90. Hindustan Unilever is included as one of the stocks in the benchmark Nifty 50 index. Financial Snapshot: The revenue for Hindustan Unilever for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 16,514 Crore, compared to Rs 15,707 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the quarter stood at Rs 2,769 Crore, compared to Rs 2,614 Crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous year. The EPS stood at Rs 11.73 in June 2025, compared to Rs 11.11 in June 2024. The revenue for the year-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 63,121 Crore, an increase compared to Rs 61,896 Crore in March 2024. The net profit for the year stood at Rs 10,679 Crore, compared to Rs 10,286 Crore in the previous year. The EPS stood at Rs 45.32 in March 2025, compared to Rs 43.74 in March 2024. title: Vodafone Idea's share rise 6 percent as plea against DoT's AGR demand tentatively listed for hearing on September 19
content: Vodafone Idea's case against Department of Telecom's (DoT) assessment of the additional Adjusted Gross Revenue (AGR) dues is tentatively listed for hearing on September 19, as per news reports, sending the shares sharply higher by over 6 percent in early trade. The telecom firm had moved the Supreme Court seeking to quash the additional demand of AGR dues worth Rs 9,450 crore by the DoT, and argued that the demand exceeds the scope of the Court’s earlier ruling on AGR liabilities. Earlier on September 12, the Economic Times had reported citing people familiar with the development that the DoT is expected to file a submission defending the demand as a 'gap' in prior accounting, which was not calculated at the time of the Supreme Court's order in 2019. An affidavit in this regard was filed by the DoT before the apex court, the report said, justifying that the additional demand was not a reassessment or recalculation but due to completion of financial accounts. What the DoT is Seeking The DoT had raised an extra demand on AGR dues worth Rs 2,774 crore for FY18-19. The petition said that out of the total Re 9,450 crore of demand, Rs 2,774 crore pertains to post-merger entity — Idea Group and Vodafone Idea — following their August 2018 consolidation, while Rs 5,675 crore relates to the pre-merger Vodafone Group’s liabilities. Vodafone Idea has contested the calculation, claiming that certain amounts have been added twice and need reconciliation. The company has asked for a recalculation of dues, starting from the pre-FY17 period. Vi Engaged with the Centre The telecom major has been engaged with banks over additional funding, and those discussions have been moving forward. "The banks are currently looking for some clarity on the AGR front. So that is where we are engaged with the government," Akshaya Moondra, CEO of Vodafone Idea said during the June quarter earnings call, expressing confidence of a solution to the AGR issue. Vodafone Idea has been keen on continuing the capex, which has been going on since last year, and is looking at non-banking sources of funding too. "In the past, we have always seen that government has been supportive. You look at 2019 deferment of spectrum instalments, 2021 Reforms Package, 2023 conversion of government dues to equity, 2025 again, conversion of government dues to equity. Generally, these actions have happened," Akshaya Moondra said in August, adding, "Our request to the government has been that let us resolve this earlier than before the deadline of March, so that banks get clarity and we can proceed with bank funding." Shares of Vodafone Idea are higher by 25 percent over the last one month and are trading flat on YTD basis.
summary_lexrank: The telecom firm had moved the Supreme Court seeking to quash the additional demand of AGR dues worth Rs 9,450 crore by the DoT, and argued that the demand exceeds the scope of the Court’s earlier ruling on AGR liabilities.
summary_luhn: The telecom firm had moved the Supreme Court seeking to quash the additional demand of AGR dues worth Rs 9,450 crore by the DoT, and argued that the demand exceeds the scope of the Court’s earlier ruling on AGR liabilities.
summary_lsa: Vodafone Idea has contested the calculation, claiming that certain amounts have been added twice and need reconciliation.
summary_textrank: The telecom firm had moved the Supreme Court seeking to quash the additional demand of AGR dues worth Rs 9,450 crore by the DoT, and argued that the demand exceeds the scope of the Court’s earlier ruling on AGR liabilities.

title: Larsen & Toubro shares gain 0.73% in morning trade; over 2.9 lakh shares traded
content: Shares of Larsen & Toubro were trading with gains in Monday's session. At 10:20 am, the stock was trading at Rs 3,606 on the NSE, up 0.73% from the previous close. Over 2.9 lakh shares changed hands in the session. Trading Volume & Market Impact On the NSE, the traded volume for Larsen & Toubro shares reached 297,623. Financial Performance The following table summarizes the consolidated quarterly financial data for Larsen & Toubro:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 55,119.82 CroreRs 61,554.58 CroreRs 64,667.78 CroreRs 74,392.28 CroreRs 63,678.92 CroreNet ProfitRs 3,440.11 CroreRs 4,112.81 CroreRs 4,001.03 CroreRs 6,133.44 CroreRs 4,325.57 CroreEPS20.2624.6924.4339.9826.30The revenue for Larsen & Toubro in the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 63,678.92 Crore, an increase compared to Rs 55,119.82 Crore in the quarter-ending June 2024. Earnings per share (EPS) increased from 20.26 in June 2024 to 26.30 in June 2025. title: Buy Aadhar Housing Finance; target of Rs 625: ICICI Securities
content: ICICI Securities research report on Aadhar Housing Finance We hosted Aadhar Housing Finance (Aadhar) in Singapore for an investor roadshow. Takeaways: I) Housing finance market in India is broadly categorised into three segments - prime (>INR 3.5mn), mid-income (INR 1.5mn-3.5mn) and low-income affordable (<INR 1.5mn), and Aadhar is the largest HFC in low-income housing in terms of disbursements (~INR 20bn in Q1FY26), profitability (Q1FY26 PAT of INR 2.4bn) and distribution (591 branches as on Jun’25), II) dedicated urban and emerging vertical to ensure growth and spread going ahead and III) relatively lower exposure to South (~30% of total branches) and LAP (~27% as on Jun’25) to ensure better asset quality outcome in near term. Retain BUY. Outlook Overall, it expects 18-20% disbursement growth and 20-22% AUM growth in the near term. For all recommendations report, click here Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions. Aadhar Housing Finance - 15092025 - icici
summary_lexrank: ICICI Securities research report on Aadhar Housing Finance We hosted Aadhar Housing Finance (Aadhar) in Singapore for an investor roadshow.
summary_luhn: Takeaways: I) Housing finance market in India is broadly categorised into three segments - prime (>INR 3.5mn), mid-income (INR 1.5mn-3.5mn) and low-income affordable (<INR 1.5mn), and Aadhar is the largest HFC in low-income housing in terms of disbursements (~INR 20bn in Q1FY26), profitability (Q1FY26 PAT of INR 2.4bn) and distribution (591 branches as on Jun’25), II) dedicated urban and emerging vertical to ensure growth and spread going ahead and III) relatively lower exposure to South (~30% of total branches) and LAP (~27% as on Jun’25) to ensure better asset quality outcome in near term.

title: SJVN share price rises 2.61%; stock among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of SJVN were trading at Rs 95.48, up 2.61% in Monday's session. The stock is among the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index. Financial Performance: SJVN's consolidated financial performance shows the following trends: Quarterly Results:Revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 917.45 Crore, compared to Rs 870.37 Crore in June 2024.Net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 236.89 Crore, down from Rs 356.19 Crore in June 2024.EPS for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 0.58, compared to Rs 0.91 in June 2024.Annual Results:Revenue for the year-ending March 2025 increased to Rs 3,072.01 Crore, up from Rs 2,579.37 Crore in March 2024.Net profit for the year-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 812.32 Crore, down from Rs 907.25 Crore in March 2024.EPS for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 2.08, compared to Rs 2.32 in March 2024.ParticularsMar 2021Mar 2022Mar 2023Mar 2024Mar 2025SalesRs 2,485 CroreRs 2,417 CroreRs 2,938 CroreRs 2,579 CroreRs 3,072 CroreOther IncomeRs 737 CroreRs 217 CroreRs 344 CroreRs 297 CroreRs 304 CroreTotal IncomeRs 3,222 CroreRs 2,634 CroreRs 3,282 CroreRs 2,876 CroreRs 3,376 CroreTotal ExpenditureRs 1,044 CroreRs 1,161 CroreRs 1,144 CroreRs 1,250 CroreRs 1,539 CroreEBITRs 2,178 CroreRs 1,472 CroreRs 2,137 CroreRs 1,626 CroreRs 1,836 CroreInterestRs -2 CroreRs 161 CroreRs 414 CroreRs 457 CroreRs 743 CroreTaxRs 539 CroreRs 326 CroreRs 368 CroreRs 262 CroreRs 280 CroreNet ProfitRs 1,641 CroreRs 985 CroreRs 1,355 CroreRs 907 CroreRs 812 CroreThe revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was increased by approximately 19.17 percent compared to the year-ending March 2024. title: Rail Vikas Nigam shares surge 4.70% amid high volume trading
content: Shares of Rail Vikas Nigam gained 4.70% to trade at Rs 354.00 in Monday's session, witnessing high volume. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty Midcap 150 index. On September 10, 2025, Rail Vikas Nigam Limited emerged as the Lowest Bidder (L1) from West Central Railway for normal business operations. On September 8, 2025, the company's application for the Formation of Wholly Owned Subsidiary Company from the Department of Investment and Public Asset Management (DIPAM) was not granted. Shri Sukhmal Chand Jain assumed the charge on September 1, 2025, as Chairman & Managing Director of Rail Vikas Nigam Limited.Rail Vikas Nigam Financial PerformanceHere is a summary of Rail Vikas Nigam's financial performance based on consolidated figures:Income Statement - QuarterlyThe following table presents the quarterly income statement data for Rail Vikas Nigam:Jun 2025Mar 2025Dec 2024Sep 2024Jun 2024SalesRs 3,908 CroreRs 6,426 CroreRs 4,567 CroreRs 4,854 CroreRs 4,073 CroreOther IncomeRs 228 CroreRs 187 CroreRs 268 CroreRs 281 CroreRs 262 CroreTotal IncomeRs 4,136 CroreRs 6,613 CroreRs 4,836 CroreRs 5,136 CroreRs 4,336 CroreTotal ExpenditureRs 3,864 CroreRs 6,003 CroreRs 4,335 CroreRs 4,590 CroreRs 3,899 CroreEBITRs 272 CroreRs 610 CroreRs 500 CroreRs 545 CroreRs 437 CroreInterestRs 108 CroreRs 116 CroreRs 144 CroreRs 140 CroreRs 137 CroreTaxRs 39 CroreRs 87 CroreRs 101 CroreRs 102 CroreRs 77 CroreNet ProfitRs 124 CroreRs 406 CroreRs 254 CroreRs 302 CroreRs 222 CroreIncome Statement - YearlyThe following table presents the yearly income statement data:Mar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023Mar 2022Mar 2021SalesRs 19,923 CroreRs 21,889 CroreRs 20,281 CroreRs 19,381 CroreRs 15,403 CroreOther IncomeRs 999 CroreRs 1,185 CroreRs 996 CroreRs 800 CroreRs 309 CroreTotal IncomeRs 20,922 CroreRs 23,074 CroreRs 21,278 CroreRs 20,181 CroreRs 15,713 CroreTotal ExpenditureRs 18,828 CroreRs 20,452 CroreRs 19,057 CroreRs 18,219 CroreRs 14,546 CroreEBITRs 2,094 CroreRs 2,622 CroreRs 2,220 CroreRs 1,962 CroreRs 1,166 CroreInterestRs 539 CroreRs 568 CroreRs 581 CroreRs 563 CroreRs 28 CroreTaxRs 368 CroreRs 479 CroreRs 377 CroreRs 319 CroreRs 215 CroreNet ProfitRs 1,186 CroreRs 1,574 CroreRs 1,261 CroreRs 1,079 CroreRs 922 CroreThe revenue for the year-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 19,923.02 Crore, compared to Rs 21,889.23 Crore in March 2024, representing a decrease. title: Railway stocks steam ahead on order wins; RVNL, Ircon, Texmaco Rail rally up to 8%
content: Railway stocks were in the spotlight on September 15, bucking the otherwise subdued mood in the broader market. Shares of RVNL, Ircon International, Titagarh Rail, Jupiter Wagons, Texmaco Rail, and IRFC surged in the range of 2 percent to 8 percent, lifted by a string of fresh order wins and a robust business outlook. The rally built on momentum from last week, when most of these counters had also advanced between 2 percent and 4 percent. Catch all the market action on our LIVE blog Individually, last week was filled with news updates and order wins for these counters. RVNL emerged as the lowest bidder for a major contract from West Central Railway. The project involves design or modification, supply, erection, testing, and commissioning of a 220/132kV/2X25 kV Scott-connected traction substation and switching posts with AT, including SCADA work, along the Bina to RTA section of Bhopal Division. The work is aimed at supporting a 3,000 metric tonne loading target. Separately, Texmaco Rail secured a Letter of Acceptance from Rail Vikas Nigam Limited for an order worth Rs 129.09 crore (inclusive of all taxes). The contract pertains to the design, supply, erection, testing, and commissioning of 2x25 kV traction overhead equipment and associated works at the Yavatmal–Digras section of the Nagpur Division in Central Railways. Meanwhile, Jupiter Wagons’ unlisted subsidiary, Jupiter Tatravagonka Railwheel Factory, bagged a Letter of Acceptance from the Ministry of Railways, Railway Board on September 9, 2025. The order is for the supply of 9,000 LHB axles for FIAT-IR bogies, valued at around Rs 113 crore. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

title: Tata Communications shares rise 2.17% in morning trade
content: Tata Communications shares gained 2.17% to trade at Rs 1,649.00 in Monday's session. At 10:15 am, the stock showed positive movement compared to its previous close. The company's consolidated financial performance shows consistent revenue growth. Quarterly revenue increased from Rs 5,633.37 Crore in June 2024 to Rs 5,959.85 Crore in June 2025. However, net profit saw a decline from Rs 329.90 Crore to Rs 183.63 Crore over the same period. Here's a summary of Tata Communication's quarterly financial performance:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 5,633.37 CroreRs 5,767.35 CroreRs 5,798.07 CroreRs 5,990.35 CroreRs 5,959.85 CroreNet ProfitRs 329.90 CroreRs 223.28 CroreRs 223.88 CroreRs 1,017.19 CroreRs 183.63 CroreEPS11.687.978.2836.506.67The company's annual financial performance also reflects growth. title: Tata Consultancy Services shares among top losers on Nifty 50, decline 0.73%

At 10:10 am, the stock was trading at Rs 3,110.50 on the NSE, a decline of 0.73% from the previous close. title: Tube Investments of India shares surge 2.68% amid high volume trading
content: Shares of Tube Investments of India Ltd were trading with a gain of 2.68% at Rs 3,317.80 at 10:15 am on Monday. The stock witnessed high volume and a surge in trading activity. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty Midcap 150 index. Financial Performance: Consolidated Quarterly Results: The company's consolidated quarterly revenue has shown an increasing trend over the last five quarters:June 2024: Rs 4,577.92 CroreSeptember 2024: Rs 4,924.55 CroreDecember 2024: Rs 4,812.22 CroreMarch 2025: Rs 5,149.96 CroreJune 2025: Rs 5,309.06 CroreThe net profit for the same period has fluctuated, with a notable dip in March 2025:June 2024: Rs 313.80 CroreSeptember 2024: Rs 299.30 CroreDecember 2024: Rs 280.22 CroreMarch 2025: Rs 158.22 CroreJune 2025: Rs 303.28 CroreThe earnings per share (EPS) also reflect this trend:June 2024: Rs 11.64September 2024: Rs 10.69December 2024: Rs 10.01March 2025: Rs 2.41June 2025: Rs 10.28Consolidated Yearly Results: The company's consolidated yearly revenue has increased consistently over the past five years. In 2025, the revenue was Rs 19,464.65 Crore, which is a significant increase compared to Rs 6,083.29 Crore in 2021. Net profit has also generally increased, although there was a slight decrease in 2025. The net profit for the year ending March 2025 stood at Rs 1,054.67 Crore, compared to Rs 304.69 Crore in 2021. EPS has also seen an increase over the years, reaching Rs 34.83 in March 2025. Book Value Per Share (BVPS) has increased from Rs 130.07 in 2021 to Rs 286.08 in 2025. The Return on Equity (ROE) was 12.17% in 2025, compared to 13.18% in 2021. The debt-to-equity ratio has decreased from 0.61 in 2021 to 0.08 in 2025. The company announced a final dividend of Rs 1.50 per share (150%) on May 15, 2025, with an effective date of July 25, 2025. Moneycontrol analysis on September 8, 2025, indicated a bullish sentiment for the stock.

In other news, Hindustan Unilever announced a final dividend of Rs 24 per share (2400%) with an effective date of June 23, 2025. Earlier dividends include an interim dividend of Rs 19 per share (1900%) and a special dividend of Rs 10 per share (1000%), both with an effective date of November 6, 2024. Historical bonus issues include a 1:2 bonus ratio announced on September 30, 1991. A stock split was announced on July 5, 2000, with an old face value of Rs 10 split into a new face value of Rs 1. As per Moneycontrol analysis on September 8, 2025, the sentiment for Hindustan Unilever is bullish. With the stock currently trading at Rs 2,582, Hindustan Unilever is showing a marginal rise in today's session.

title: ITC shares trade flat in morning session

title: Dr Reddys Labs, Infosys stocks among top losers on Nifty 50
content: Shares of Dr Reddys Labs and Infosys were among the top losers on the Nifty 50 at 10:00 am on Monday. Dr Reddys Labs traded at Rs 1,295.60, a fall of 1.6%. Infosys was trading at Rs 1,506.20, down 1.27% from its previous close. Other stocks that were among the top losers on the Nifty 50 were Asian Paints (down 1.19%), Shriram Finance (down 0.92%), and HDFC Life (down 0.83%). Dr Reddys Labs Financial Highlights: There is no quarterly and yearly data available for Dr Reddys Labs Infosys Financial Highlights: Infosys's consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 42,279 Crore, compared to Rs 39,315 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 6,924 Crore, while in June 2024, it was Rs 6,374 Crore. The EPS for June 2025 was Rs 16.70, up from Rs 15.38 in June 2024. The consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 162,990 Crore, an increase from Rs 153,670 Crore in March 2024. The net profit increased to Rs 26,750 Crore in March 2025 from Rs 26,248 Crore in March 2024. The EPS rose to Rs 64.50 in March 2025 from Rs 63.39 in March 2024.AnnualMar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023Mar 2022Mar 2021SalesRs 162,990 CroreRs 153,670 CroreRs 146,767 CroreRs 121,641 CroreRs 100,472 CroreOther IncomeRs 3,600 CroreRs 4,711 CroreRs 2,701 CroreRs 2,295 CroreRs 2,201 CroreTotal IncomeRs 166,590 CroreRs 158,381 CroreRs 149,468 CroreRs 123,936 CroreRs 102,673 CroreTotal ExpenditureRs 128,566 CroreRs 121,923 CroreRs 115,862 CroreRs 93,626 CroreRs 75,850 CroreEBITRs 38,024 CroreRs 36,458 CroreRs 33,606 CroreRs 30,310 CroreRs 26,823 CroreInterestRs 416 CroreRs 470 CroreRs 284 CroreRs 200 CroreRs 195 CroreTaxRs 10,858 CroreRs 9,740 CroreRs 9,214 CroreRs 7,964 CroreRs 7,205 CroreNet ProfitRs 26,750 CroreRs 26,248 CroreRs 24,108 CroreRs 22,146 CroreRs 19,423 CroreAsian Paints Financial Highlights: Asian Paints's consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 8,938 Crore, compared to Rs 8,969.73 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 1,080.73 Crore, while in June 2024, it was Rs 1,150.07 Crore. The EPS for June 2025 was Rs 11.47, down from Rs 12.20 in June 2024. The consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 33,905.62 Crore, a decrease from Rs 35,494.73 Crore in March 2024. The net profit decreased to Rs 3,569.00 Crore in March 2025 from Rs 5,424.69 Crore in March 2024. The EPS fell to Rs 38.25 in March 2025 from Rs 56.95 in March 2024. title: Bajaj Finance, Bajaj Auto among top gainers on Nifty 50
content: At 10:00 am on Monday, shares of Bajaj Finance and Bajaj Auto were among the top gainers on the Nifty 50. Bajaj Finance gained 1.94% with the stock trading at Rs 1,022.75. The other top gainers on Nifty 50 were Bajaj Auto (0.87%), Coal India (0.61%), Larsen (0.6%), and Hero Motocorp (0.48%). The following is a detailed look into the financials of the top gainers:Bajaj FinanceThe consolidated revenue for Bajaj Finance has shown consistent growth over the past five years. The annual revenue increased from Rs 26,668.10 Crore in 2021 to Rs 69,683.51 Crore in 2025. Net profit also saw a substantial increase from Rs 4,419.82 Crore in 2021 to Rs 16,761.67 Crore in 2025. Earnings per share (EPS) rose from Rs 73.58 in 2021 to Rs 268.94 in 2025. title: Rail Vikas Nigam, Vodafone Idea stocks among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150 in morning trade
content: At 10:00 am on Monday, shares of Rail Vikas and Vodafone Idea were among the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150. Rail Vikas was trading at Rs 352.15, a gain of 4.16%. Vodafone Idea was trading at Rs 7.97, up 4.05%. Other gainers on the index included IREDA, Cochin Shipyard and Tube Investments. Rail Vikas Nigam Financial Overview Rail Vikas Nigam's financial performance shows a fluctuating trend in both quarterly and annual results. The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 3,908.77 Crore, down from Rs 6,426.88 Crore in March 2025. The net profit for the same quarter stood at Rs 124.99 Crore, significantly lower than the Rs 406.74 Crore reported in the previous quarter. The following table presents Rail Vikas Nigam's quarterly financial performance:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 4,073.80 CroreRs 4,854.95 CroreRs 4,567.38 CroreRs 6,426.88 CroreRs 3,908.77 CroreNet ProfitRs 222.56 CroreRs 302.14 CroreRs 254.66 CroreRs 406.74 CroreRs 124.99 CroreEPS1.071.381.492.200.65The company’s annual results provide a broader perspective. For the year-ending March 2025, Rail Vikas Nigam reported a revenue of Rs 19,923.02 Crore, a decrease from Rs 21,889.23 Crore in the previous year. The net profit also declined to Rs 1,186.11 Crore from Rs 1,574.47 Crore. Earnings per share (EPS) stood at Rs 6.15, compared to Rs 7.55 in the previous year. The following table summarizes Rail Vikas Nigam's yearly financial performance:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 15,403.76 CroreRs 19,381.71 CroreRs 20,281.57 CroreRs 21,889.23 CroreRs 19,923.02 CroreNet ProfitRs 922.85 CroreRs 1,079.17 CroreRs 1,261.95 CroreRs 1,574.47 CroreRs 1,186.11 CroreEPS4.425.676.817.556.15BVPS26.7030.6835.1341.9545.90ROE16.5618.4819.3918.0013.38Debt to Equity1.021.030.870.680.56The sales for year ending March 2025 stood at Rs 19,923 Crore compared to Rs 21,889 Crore for year ending March 2024. Rail Vikas Nigam announced that it emerged as the Lowest Bidder (L1) from West Central Railway, in the normal course of business for the company. Shri Sukhmal Chand Jain, IRSE, AM/L&A, Railway Board has assumed the charge on September 1, 2025, as Chairman & Managing Director of Rail Vikas Nigam Limited. The company announced a final dividend of Rs 1.72 per share (17.2%) with an effective date of August 21, 2025. Vodafone Idea Financials Vodafone Idea's financial results reveal ongoing challenges. title: Glenmark shares fall 1.81%; stock among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of Glenmark were among the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index, with the stock declining by 1.81% to Rs 2,094.00. Other top losers on the index included Sundaram Fin, Ola Electric, Aurobindo Pharm, and J. K. Cement. title: Power Finance Corporation shares rise 2.05% in early trade
content: Shares of Power Finance Corporation gained 2.05% to trade at Rs 403.80 in Monday's early trading session. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty Next 50 index. On the financial front, Power Finance Corporation has demonstrated strong performance. The consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 106,501.62 Crore, up from Rs 91,096.72 Crore in the previous year. The net profit for the same period was Rs 30,514.65 Crore, compared to Rs 26,461.36 Crore in the previous year. The company's consolidated quarterly performance shows consistent growth. Revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 28,539.04 Crore, an increase from Rs 24,716.76 Crore in the quarter-ending June 2024. The net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 8,981.45 Crore, up from Rs 7,182.06 Crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous year.Financial YearRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)202171,655.9415,709.9644.50202276,261.6618,790.6153.08202377,568.3021,178.5860.19202491,096.7226,461.3659.882025106,501.6230,514.6569.67The annual income statement shows that sales increased from Rs 91,096 Crore in March 2024 to Rs 106,501 Crore in March 2025. Net profit also rose from Rs 26,461 Crore to Rs 30,514 Crore during the same period.QuarterSales (Rs Crore)Other Income (Rs Crore)Total Income (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)Jun 202424,7161924,7367,182Sep 202425,7213225,7547,214Dec 202426,7982326,8217,759Mar 202529,2652029,2858,358Jun 202528,5398928,6288,981The quarterly income statement indicates a rise in sales and net profit from June 2024 to June 2025. Key financial ratios for Power Finance Corporation as of March 2025 include a basic EPS of Rs 69.67, diluted EPS of Rs 69.67, and a book value per share of Rs 356.77. The company’s debt to equity ratio stood at 8.25 as of March 2025.RatioMar 2021Mar 2022Mar 2023Mar 2024Mar 2025Basic EPS (Rs.)44.5053.0860.1959.8869.67Diluted Eps (Rs.)44.5053.0860.1959.8869.67Book Value /Share (Rs.)309.80364.67424.16406.92356.77Dividend/Share (Rs.)10.0012.0013.2513.5015.80Debt to Equity (x)10.869.218.938.528.25Interest Coverage Ratios (X)1.451.521.561.581.60P/E (x)2.041.702.026.525.95P/B (x)0.490.410.481.271.16Power Finance Corporation announced several dividends, including an interim dividend of Rs 3.70 per share (37%) with an effective date of August 18, 2025, and a final dividend of Rs 2.05 per share (20.5%) with an effective date of June 13, 2025. The company issued a bonus share on 21 Sep, 2023 in the ratio of 1:4 and on 26 Aug, 2016 in the ratio of 1:1. A Moneycontrol analysis on September 10, 2025, indicated bearish sentiment for the stock. title: IREDA shares rise 2.10% in early trade
content: Shares of Indian Renewable Energy Development Agency were trading higher by 2.10% at Rs 150.45 in early trade, compared to the previous close. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty Midcap 150 index. Financial Highlights: Indian Renewable Energy Development Agency's annual revenue has demonstrated substantial growth. The consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 6,743.32 Crore, a notable increase compared to Rs 4,963.93 Crore in March 2024 and Rs 2,654.81 Crore in March 2021. The company's net profit also experienced significant growth, reaching Rs 1,698.34 Crore for the year-ending March 2025, compared to Rs 1,252.24 Crore in March 2024. The Earnings per share (EPS) increased to Rs 6.32 in March 2025 from Rs 5.16 in March 2024. title: HUDCO shares rise 2.02% in early trade

Corporation of India announced several corporate actions. The company announced change in senior management on September 08, 2025. The company also released press release regarding signing of MOU on September 04, 2025. Also, newspaper publication of Notice to Shareholders for 37th AGM of the Company was announced on September 02, 2025. The company announced interim dividend of Rs 1.60 per share (32%) with effective date as August 13, 2025. A final dividend of Rs 2.00 per share (40%) was announced on May 22, 2025, with effective date as June 06, 2025. The company announced bonus issue with bonus ratio of 1:4, announcement date was May 22, 2025 and exbonus date was July 04, 2025. The company had split its face value from 10 to 5, announcement date was April 30, 2018 and exsplit date was June 26, 2018. Container Corporation of India is a constituent of the Nifty Midcap 150 index. Moneycontrol's sentiment analysis, conducted on September 8, 2025, suggests a neutral outlook for the stock.

title: Godrej Industries shares rise 2.20% in early trade
content: Godrej Industries shares were trading higher in Monday's session. At 09:45 am, the stock was priced at Rs 1,237.30 on the NSE, a 2.20% increase from the previous close. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty Midcap 150 index. Financial Snapshot: The following table presents the consolidated quarterly financial performance of Godrej Industries:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 4,247.93 CroreRs 4,804.96 CroreRs 4,824.83 CroreRs 5,779.69 CroreRs 4,459.80 CroreNet ProfitRs 580.15 CroreRs 363.35 CroreRs 198.73 CroreRs 341.40 CroreRs 632.85 CroreEPS9.588.545.595.4410.37The revenue for Godrej Industries has seen fluctuations over the past quarters. The revenue increased from Rs 4,247.93 Crore in June 2024 to Rs 5,779.69 Crore by March 2025, before falling to Rs 4,459.80 Crore in June 2025. Similarly, net profit also fluctuated, reaching Rs 632.85 Crore in June 2025, compared to Rs 580.15 Crore in June 2024. The following table presents the consolidated yearly financial performance of Godrej Industries:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 9,333.51 CroreRs 14,130.15 CroreRs 16,740.25 CroreRs 16,600.62 CroreRs 19,657.41 CroreNet ProfitRs 37.19 CroreRs 707.48 CroreRs 1,025.17 CroreRs 648.44 CroreRs 1,483.62 CroreEPS9.9419.4228.961.7829.14BVPS397.22388.62424.86449.04301.41ROE4.429.1712.200.749.66Debt to Equity1.292.032.443.603.73The annual financial performance shows a consistent increase in revenue from Rs 9,333.51 Crore in 2021 to Rs 19,657.41 Crore in 2025. However, the net profit has fluctuated, with a significant increase to Rs 1,483.62 Crore in 2025 compared to Rs 37.19 Crore in 2021. The debt-to-equity ratio has also increased steadily, reaching 3.73 in 2025. The annual income statement data indicates that sales have risen from Rs 9,333 crore in March 2021 to Rs 19,657 crore in March 2025. Other income also increased from Rs 661 crore to Rs 2,266 crore during the same period. Total expenditure grew from Rs 9,262 crore in March 2021 to Rs 17,988 crore in March 2025. Consequently, the net profit increased from Rs 37 crore in March 2021 to Rs 1,483 crore in March 2025. According to the financial ratios, the basic EPS increased from Rs 9.94 in March 2021 to Rs 29.14 in March 2025. The book value per share decreased from Rs 397.22 in March 2021 to Rs 301.41 in March 2025. The return on net worth/equity was 9.66% as of March 2025, compared to 4.42% in March 2021. The debt-to-equity ratio increased from 1.29 in March 2021 to 3.73 in March 2025. Moneycontrol analysis as of September 8, 2025, suggests a bullish sentiment for the stock. Godrej Industries shares were trading higher in Monday's session.

title: Larsen & Toubro shares rise in early trade, as firm wins Bullet Train project order
content: Shares of Larsen & Toubro gained as much as 0.7% in the morning trade to Rs 3,603.9 on the NSE on Monday. The engineering and construction giant announced it has secured a large order worth Rs 2,500-5,000 crore for the Mumbai-Ahmedabad Bullet Train project. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty 50 index.Financial PerformanceLarsen & Toubro's consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 63,678.92 Crore, compared to Rs 55,119.82 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 4,325.57 Crore, up from Rs 3,440.11 Crore in the previous year. The company's consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 255,734.45 Crore, an increase compared to Rs 221,112.91 Crore in March 2024. The net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 17,687.39 Crore, up from Rs 15,569.72 Crore in the previous year. Consolidated Quarterly Financials (Rs. title: Rice exporter KRBL's director says dissent 'suppressed or sidelined' in resignation over 'governance' issues
content: Shares of leading basmati rice producer KRBL are sharply lower by over 9 percent on September 15 after a company filing revealed that an independent director has resigned from the board citing concerns around governance standards. Anil Kumar Chaudhary had resigned on September 08, 2025 with immediate effect, and the company informed the exchanges about the development the next day, with the resignation letter citing the reason shared in a filing on September 14. The director cited 'certain issues' that have persisted despite efforts to address them, which have posed 'professional and ethical dilemmas'. "...I am no longer able to meaningfully contribute to the Board's functioning in the manner envisioned under the regulatory framework for independent directors," Anil Kumar Chaudhary said in his resignation letter. He also cited some concerns around governance of the board, which have likely unsettled investors in the shares of the company, leading the sharp selloff. "I believe that effective governance and truly independent oversight are essential ingredients for safeguarding stakeholder interests and I find the prevailing dynamics of the Board to be inconsistent with these principles," he added. One of the grave charges mentioned in the resignation letter by Chaudhary has alleged that dissent on the board of KRBL is 'suppressed or sidelined'. "In such an operating environment where dissent is suppressed or sidelined, remaining on the Board would compromise both my professional ethics and obligations as defined under Indian corporate governance codes," Chaudhary said. The director cited 'certain issues' that have persisted despite efforts to address them, which have posed 'professional and ethical dilemmas'. Citing specifics, Anil Kumar Chaudhary said there have been 'inconsistencies' in the recording of minutes of board and committee meetings, and there have been 'instances of information being withheld', which he said has impacted informed decision-making. Some concerns were also cited relating to the financials of the company, wherein 'unjust write-off' of certain export receivables were carried out without adequate deliberation. The outgoing director also raised concerns around the use of CSR funds. There has also been 'arbitrary distribution' of Variable Pay and Annual Increments to persons holding office or profit, the director said. Citing another instance, Anil Kumar Chaudhary said, 'significant changes' to the object clause was undertaken 'without comprehensive discussion', and there has been 'undue interference' by invitees during board meetings. There has been no comment so far by the company on the accusations by the outgoing director against the company. Despite the sharp selloff, shares of KRBL have been higher by over 32 percent so far this year. During the June quarter, KRBL's export revenue came in at Rs 489 crore, reflecting a 98 percent YoY growth. with total revenue came at Rs 1,584 crore on strong momentum in the export business. The company reported an EBITDA of Rs 225 crore and a net profit of Rs 151 crore.
summary_lexrank: He also cited some concerns around governance of the board, which have likely unsettled investors in the shares of the company, leading the sharp selloff.
summary_luhn: He also cited some concerns around governance of the board, which have likely unsettled investors in the shares of the company, leading the sharp selloff.
summary_lsa: Shares of leading basmati rice producer KRBL are sharply lower by over 9 percent on September 15 after a company filing revealed that an independent director has resigned from the board citing concerns around governance standards.
summary_textrank: Anil Kumar Chaudhary had resigned on September 08, 2025 with immediate effect, and the company informed the exchanges about the development the next day, with the resignation letter citing the reason shared in a filing on September 14.

title: Rail Vikas Nigam shares rise 2.23% in early trade

the Lowest Bidder (L1) from West Central Railway in the normal course of business, according to an announcement on September 10, 2025. On September 8, 2025, it was announced that the approval for the formation of a Wholly Owned Subsidiary Company from the Department of Investment and Public Asset Management (DIPAM) was not granted. Shri Sukhmal Chand Jain assumed the charge as Chairman & Managing Director of Rail Vikas Nigam Limited on September 1, 2025. The company announced a final dividend of Rs 1.72 per share (17.2%) on May 21, 2025, with an effective date of August 21, 2025. Rail Vikas Nigam's stock currently trades at Rs 345.65, reflecting a gain of 2.23% in early trading.

title: BSE Limited shares rise 2.16% in early trade
content: Shares of BSE Limited gained 2.16% to trade at Rs 2,248.80 in Monday's early session. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty Midcap 150 index. Financial Performance: BSE Limited's consolidated revenue and net profit have shown substantial growth. The annual revenue increased from Rs 501.37 Crore in 2021 to Rs 3,212.04 Crore in 2025. Net profit also saw a significant rise from Rs 98.55 Crore in 2021 to Rs 1,234.47 Crore in 2025. title: Dr Reddys Labs shares fall 1.37%; stock among top losers on Nifty 50
content: At 9:30 am on Monday, Dr Reddys Labs shares were trading at Rs 1,298.70, a decline of 1.37% on the NSE. The stock is among the top losers on the Nifty 50. Among other top losers on the Nifty 50 were SBI Life Insurance, Cipla, Shriram Finance and TCS. SBI Life Insura, Shriram Finance SBI Life Insura shares were trading lower, with the stock priced at Rs 1,816.90, a 0.73% fall. Shriram Finance shares were trading at Rs 629.20, a fall of 0.58%. Cipla Cipla shares were down 0.62%, trading at Rs 1,564.80. The company has shown consistent quarterly revenue growth, with the latest figure for June 2025 at Rs 6,957.47 Crore, compared to Rs 6,693.94 Crore in June 2024. Net profit for June 2025 stood at Rs 1,292.05 Crore. Annually, Cipla’s revenue has increased steadily, reaching Rs 27,547.62 Crore in March 2025, up from Rs 25,774.09 Crore in March 2024. The net profit saw significant growth, reaching Rs 5,291.05 Crore in March 2025, compared to Rs 4,155.31 Crore in March 2024. Basic EPS for March 2025 was Rs 65.29, compared to Rs 51.05 for March 2024. The company's Return on Net Worth (ROE) was 16.90% for March 2025, compared to 15.43% for March 2024. Cipla has announced final dividends, including Rs 13.00 per share and a special dividend of Rs 3.00 per share, both effective June 27, 2025. TCS TCS shares were trading at Rs 3,118.00, a decline of 0.49%. TCS has demonstrated consistent quarterly revenue, with June 2025 revenue at Rs 63,437.00 Crore. The net profit for June 2025 was Rs 12,819.00 Crore. Annually, TCS has shown steady growth, with revenue reaching Rs 255,324.00 Crore in March 2025, up from Rs 240,893.00 Crore in March 2024. The net profit increased to Rs 48,797.00 Crore in March 2025, compared to Rs 46,099.00 Crore in March 2024. Basic EPS for March 2025 was Rs 134.19. The company’s Return on Net Worth (ROE) was 51.24% for March 2025. TCS has a history of bonus issues, with the last one being on April 19, 2018, in the ratio of 1:1. Dr Reddys Labs shares were trading at Rs 1,298.70, a decline of 1.37% on the NSE.
summary_lexrank: Cipla Cipla shares were down 0.62%, trading at Rs 1,564.80.
summary_luhn: The company has shown consistent quarterly revenue growth, with the latest figure for June 2025 at Rs 6,957.47 Crore, compared to Rs 6,693.94 Crore in June 2024.
summary_lsa: Among other top losers on the Nifty 50 were SBI Life Insurance, Cipla, Shriram Finance and TCS.
summary_textrank: The company has shown consistent quarterly revenue growth, with the latest figure for June 2025 at Rs 6,957.47 Crore, compared to Rs 6,693.94 Crore in June 2024.

title: IRB Infrastructure Developers shares rise 2.27% in early trade
content: IRB Infrastructure Developers shares were trading at Rs 43.65, up 2.27% from the previous close, in early trade on Monday. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty Midcap 150 index. Financial Performance: Consolidated Quarterly Performance: The company's consolidated quarterly revenue has shown a fluctuating trend. The revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 2,098.97 Crore, compared to Rs 2,149.24 Crore in March 2025, Rs 2,025.44 Crore in December 2024, Rs 1,585.84 Crore in September 2024, and Rs 1,852.94 Crore in June 2024. Net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 202.48 Crore, compared to Rs 214.72 Crore in March 2025. Notably, the net profit surged to Rs 6,026.11 Crore in December 2024, from Rs 183.59 Crore in September 2024 and Rs 193.37 Crore in June 2024. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 0.34, compared to Rs 0.35 in March 2025, Rs 9.98 in December 2024, Rs 0.17 in September 2024, and Rs 0.23 in June 2024.HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 1,852.94 CroreRs 1,585.84 CroreRs 2,025.44 CroreRs 2,149.24 CroreRs 2,098.97 CroreNet ProfitRs 193.37 CroreRs 183.59 CroreRs 6,026.11 CroreRs 214.72 CroreRs 202.48 CroreEPS0.230.179.980.350.34Consolidated Yearly Performance: The company's consolidated yearly revenue has also shown an increasing trend over the years. Net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 6,617.79 Crore, significantly higher than Rs 920.67 Crore in March 2024, Rs 827.02 Crore in March 2023, Rs 587.61 Crore in March 2022, and Rs 282.95 Crore in March 2021. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 10.73, compared to Rs 1.00 in March 2024, Rs 1.19 in March 2023, Rs 8.69 in March 2022, and Rs 3.33 in March 2021. title: Dr Reddys Labs shares fall 1.58%; Shriram Finance, Cipla, Asian Paints among top losers on Nifty 50
content: Dr Reddys Labs shares declined by 1.58% to Rs 1,295.90 in early trade on Monday, making it one of the top losers on the Nifty 50. Shriram Finance, SBI Life Insurance, Cipla, and Asian Paints were also among the top losers on the Nifty 50. title: Cochin Shipyard, IRB Infra stocks among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: At 9:30 am, Cochin Shipyard and IRB Infra shares emerged as top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150. Cochin Shipyard was trading at Rs 1,813.10, a 3.86% increase. IRB Infra was trading at Rs 43.45, up 1.8%. Other gainers included Phoenix Mills at Rs 1,585.20, a 1.61% rise, Tube Investment at Rs 3,283.00, a 1.6% increase and Prestige Estate at Rs 1,572.40, up 1.46%. title: Cochin Shipyard shares surge 4.51% amid high volume trading
content: Shares of Cochin Shipyard gained 4.51% to trade at Rs 1,824.50 in early trade. There was a surge in volume for the stock in today's session. On the financial front, Cochin Shipyard's consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 4,819.96 Crore, up from Rs 3,830.45 Crore in the previous year. The net profit for the same period was Rs 827.33 Crore, compared to Rs 783.28 Crore in the year-ending March 2024. The company's EPS stood at Rs 31.45 in March 2025, up from Rs 29.77 in March 2024. The company’s quarterly revenue for June 2025 was Rs 1,068.59 Crore, up from Rs 771.47 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the quarter was Rs 187.83 Crore, compared to Rs 174.24 Crore for the quarter ending June 2024. The EPS for the quarter ending June 2025 was Rs 7.14, up from Rs 6.62 in the same quarter last year. title: Nifty 50 top gainers today: Hero Motocorp, Tata Motors, Bajaj Finance stock lead gains in early trade
content: At the opening bell, several stocks showed positive movement on the Nifty 50. Hero Motocorp stock led the gains at Rs 5,343.00, up by 0.78%. Tata Motors followed, trading at Rs 720.10 with a rise of 0.68%. Bajaj Finance was also up, trading at Rs 1,009.80, gaining 0.65%. ONGC showed a more modest increase, trading at Rs 233.90, a rise of 0.28%, while ICICI Bank was up 0.26%, trading at Rs 1,421.40. Here's a detailed look into the financials of these companies:Hero Motocorp FinancialsHero Motocorp's consolidated financials reveal consistent performance. Quarterly revenue has seen slight fluctuations. For the quarter-ending June 2024, revenue stood at Rs 10,210.79 Crore, which then increased to Rs 10,482.93 Crore by September 2024, before slightly decreasing to Rs 9,727.75 Crore for the quarter-ending June 2025. Net profit also experienced slight variations, with Rs 1,086.35 Crore in June 2024, peaking at Rs 1,200.12 Crore in December 2024, and settling at Rs 1,076.21 Crore in June 2025. EPS figures showed a rise from Rs 52.31 in June 2024 to Rs 85.26 in June 2025. The annual consolidated revenue demonstrates growth, increasing from Rs 30,959.19 Crore in 2021 to Rs 40,923.42 Crore in 2025. Net profit also rose significantly from Rs 2,982.61 Crore in 2021 to Rs 4,536.93 Crore in 2025. The EPS increased from Rs 146.07 in 2021 to Rs 218.96 in 2025. BVPS has steadily increased from Rs 778.76 in 2021 to Rs 963.60 in 2025. The Return on Equity (ROE) also shows an upward trend, moving from 18.92% in 2021 to 22.71% in 2025. The debt-to-equity ratio remained stable at 0.02 over the same period.Financial YearRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)BVPS (Rs)ROE (%)Debt to Equity202130,959.192,982.61146.07778.7618.920.02202229,551.282,528.10115.96800.5414.620.02202334,158.382,796.79140.62839.6616.870.02202437,788.623,862.41187.36892.1721.150.02202540,923.424,536.93218.96963.6022.710.02Hero Motocorp has also announced dividends. In 2025, the company announced a final dividend of Rs 65 per share on May 13, 2025, with an effective date of July 24, 2025. Earlier, an interim dividend of Rs 100 per share was announced on February 6, 2025, and paid out starting February 12, 2025.Tata Motors FinancialsTata Motors' consolidated quarterly revenue has shown some volatility. Starting from Rs 108,048.00 Crore in June 2024, it decreased to Rs 101,450.00 Crore by September 2024, then rose to Rs 104,407.00 Crore in June 2025. Net profit varied from Rs 5,563.00 Crore in June 2024, dropping to Rs 3,368.00 Crore in September 2024, and recovering to Rs 3,871.00 Crore in June 2025. EPS saw a similar trend, starting at Rs 14.61 in June 2024, falling to Rs 9.72 in September 2024, and reaching Rs 10.66 in June 2025. The company’s annual consolidated revenue has increased steadily from Rs 249,794.75 Crore in 2021 to Rs 439,695.00 Crore in 2025. However, net profit has been inconsistent, with negative values in 2021 and 2022 (Rs -13,016.14 Crore and Rs -11,234.70 Crore respectively), before turning positive. In 2025, net profit stood at Rs 22,991.00 Crore. EPS followed a similar pattern, with negative values in 2021 and 2022, then turning positive to reach Rs 78.80 in 2025. BVPS has generally increased from Rs 148.39 in 2021 to Rs 315.61 in 2025. The debt-to-equity ratio has decreased over the years, from 2.08 in 2021 to 0.54 in 2025.Financial YearRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)BVPS (Rs)ROE (%)Debt to Equity2021249,794.75-13,016.14-36.99148.39-24.342.082022278,453.62-11,234.70-29.88127.50-25.673.132023345,966.962,353.496.29137.335.322.772024437,927.7731,106.9581.95242.9036.971.162025439,695.0022,991.0078.80315.6123.960.54Tata Motors has announced a final dividend of Rs 6 per share on May 13, 2025, effective from June 4, 2025.ONGC FinancialsONGC's consolidated quarterly revenue has seen fluctuations. For the quarter-ending June 2024, revenue stood at Rs 166,576.75 Crore, decreasing to Rs 158,329.10 Crore by September 2024, before reaching Rs 163,108.12 Crore for the quarter-ending June 2025. Net profit also experienced changes, with Rs 10,020.58 Crore in June 2024, dropping to Rs 8,217.12 Crore in March 2025, and recovering to Rs 11,782.10 Crore in June 2025. EPS figures varied from Rs 7.90 in June 2024 to Rs 7.79 in June 2025. The annual consolidated revenue demonstrates overall growth, increasing from Rs 304,000.98 Crore in 2021 to Rs 612,065.37 Crore in 2025, although there was a dip in 2024. Net profit also fluctuated, reaching Rs 37,293.02 Crore in 2025. The EPS increased from Rs 12.92 in 2021 to Rs 28.80 in 2025. BVPS has seen an increase from Rs 192.84 in 2021 to Rs 273.00 in 2025. The Return on Equity (ROE) has varied, settling at 10.54% in 2025. The debt-to-equity ratio has also fluctuated, at 0.45 in 2025.Financial YearRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)BVPS (Rs)ROE (%)Debt to Equity2021304,000.9820,324.0812.92192.847.350.502022491,269.8047,830.1336.19225.2217.540.422023632,325.9732,743.5528.17239.4712.620.462024591,447.1254,704.8139.13290.2114.600.362025612,065.3737,293.0228.80273.0010.540.45ONGC announced a final dividend of Rs 1.25 per share on May 21, 2025, which was effective from September 4, 2025. Overall, the market sentiment is very bullish, according to Moneycontrol analysis.

title: Tube Investments of India shares rise 2.05% in early trade
content: Shares of Tube Investments of India Ltd were trading at Rs 3,297.30, up 2.05% from the previous close, in early trade on Monday. At 09:22 am, the stock showed positive movement on the exchanges. Tube Investments of India is a constituent of the Nifty Midcap 150 index. title: DOMS Industries Announces Final Dividend of Rs 3.15, Ex-Date Due Today
content: DOMS Industries announced a final dividend of Rs 3.15 per share, with the ex-date due today, September 15, 2025. The company's stock last traded at Rs 2,596.80, reflecting a per change of 0.04% compared to the previous day's close. This dividend announcement follows a period of robust financial performance for DOMS Industries, as reflected in its recent quarterly and annual results. The dividend payout demonstrates the company's commitment to rewarding its shareholders. It's crucial for investors to note the ex-date, as those holding shares on this date will be eligible for the dividend payout. The company's market capitalization stands at 15,759.35 Crore.Dividend DetailsDividend DetailsParticularsDetailsDividend per shareRs 3.15Ex-DateSeptember 15, 2025Payment Date15 Sep 2025Financial PerformanceDOMS Industries has demonstrated consistent growth in recent years. The company's revenue has increased significantly, reaching 1,912.63 Crore for the year ending March 2025, compared to 1,537.14 Crore in the previous year. Net profit has also seen substantial growth, rising to 213.53 Crore from 159.68 Crore during the same period. This growth is reflected in the company's Earnings Per Share (EPS), which has increased from 27.75 to 33.34. The quarterly performance also indicates a positive trend. title: Godfrey Phillip Announces 2:1 Bonus Issue, Ex-Date Tomorrow
content: Godfrey Phillip announced a bonus issue of shares in the ratio of 2:1, with the ex-date due tomorrow on September 16, 2025. The company's last traded price was Rs 10,136.00, reflecting a decrease of 2.62% compared to the previous day's closing. The bonus issue means that shareholders will receive two additional shares for every one share they currently hold. Godfrey Phillip has demonstrated robust financial performance over the past year. The consolidated revenue for the year ending March 2025 stood at Rs 5,611.01 crore, up from Rs 4,419.58 crore in the previous year. The net profit also saw a significant increase, reaching Rs 943.92 crore compared to Rs 723.29 crore in the year ending March 2024. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 206.81, a notable increase from Rs 169.87 in the previous year. In terms of quarterly performance, the company reported a revenue of Rs 1,486.20 crore for the quarter ending June 2025, compared to Rs 1,170.44 crore for the same quarter last year. The net profit for the quarter ending June 2025 was Rs 291.58 crore, up from Rs 177.68 crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous year. The EPS for the June 2025 quarter was Rs 68.53, significantly higher than the Rs 44.10 reported in June 2024. The company's financial ratios indicate strong financial health. The Return on Equity (ROE) for the year ending March 2025 was 20.44%, and the Debt to Equity ratio remained low at 0.01. The Book Value Per Share (BVPS) increased to Rs 1,008.70 by March 2025. Here's a detailed look at the company's recent financial performance:Consolidated Financial Highlights (in ₹ crore)MetricJun 2025Mar 2025Dec 2024Sep 2024Jun 2024Revenue1,486.201,573.391,591.261,383.981,170.44Net Profit291.58207.37280.89197.40177.68EPS68.5353.8860.9547.9244.10Annual Consolidated Financials (in ₹ crore)MetricMar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023Mar 2022Mar 2021Revenue5,611.014,419.583,562.492,687.572,525.34Net Profit943.92723.29606.82438.05376.98EPS206.81169.87132.8084.2572.41Bonus Issue DetailsParticularsDetailsBonus Ratio2:1Ex-DateSeptember 16, 2025With the ex-date due tomorrow, shareholders should note the implications for their holdings. The last traded price for Godfrey Phillip shares was Rs 10,136.00.

title: Eternal now among top 10 most-valued stocks in MF kitty
content: Eternal Ltd, formerly known as Zomato, has made its way into the list of the 10 most-owned stocks by mutual funds, overtaking established giants such as ITC, Maruti Suzuki India and Sun Pharmaceuticals. The milestone comes despite Eternal being the costliest stock in the Nifty index, with a trailing 12-month price-to-earnings ratio of nearly 950 times. As of August end, 43 mutual funds hold shares of Eternal, with a combined holding valued at Rs 71,746 crore. In comparison, HDFC Bank remains the top mutual fund holding, with 45 funds together owning shares worth Rs 3.13 lakh crore, followed by ICICI Bank (46 funds, Rs 2.47 lakh crore) and Reliance Industries Ltd (45 funds, Rs 1.75 lakh crore). Other major holdings during the month include Infosys (45 funds, Rs 1.25 lakh crore), Bharti Airtel (Rs 1.22 lakh crore), State Bank of India (Rs 1.05 lakh crore), Larsen & Toubro (Rs 1.01 lakh crore) and Kotak Mahindra Bank (Rs 77,242 crore). Eternal has emerged as a mutual fund favourite amid a sharp rally in its stock price, which surged 108 percent in 2023, 124 percent in 2024 and has already risen over 16 percent in 2025 despite volatility in domestic equities. Analyst recommendations currently stand at 29 buy calls, zero hold and 4 sell, compared with 24 buy and 2 sell at the beginning of the year. Among the largest institutional investors, SBI Mutual Fund holds Eternal shares worth Rs 9,908 crore, followed by Kotak Mahindra Mutual Fund (Rs 7,746 crore) and Motilal Oswal Mutual Fund (Rs 6,253 crore). Other significant positions are held by HDFC Mutual Fund (Rs 5,218 crore), UTI Mutual Fund (Rs 5,200 crore), Nippon India Mutual Fund (Rs 5,100 crore), ICICI Prudential Mutual Fund (Rs 5,099 crore), Axis Mutual Fund (Rs 4,987 crore), Aditya Birla Sun Life Mutual Fund (Rs 3,416 crore), Franklin Templeton Mutual Fund (Rs 2,807 crore) and Canara Robeco Mutual Fund (Rs 2,617 crore). Mutual funds’ confidence in Eternal remains strong, as analysts project its core food delivery business to deliver margin expansion and robust free cash flow over the next three years, aided by lower capital expenditure and improved working capital efficiency. These gains are expected to bankroll the company’s quick commerce operations, which are projected to turn EBITDA profitable by the fourth quarter of FY26. Revenue growth is forecast at 42 percent, with Eternal already profitable at the PAT level. At the same time, the quick commerce market is heating up, with Amazon joining Flipkart and Reliance in taking on incumbents Blinkit, Instamart and Zepto. Experts highlight that Blinkit is scaling aggressively, with a larger store network and customer base, and enjoys stronger unit economics that translate into superior EBITDA margins compared to peers. Backed by cash reserves of Rs 18,860 crore, Eternal is well placed to step up marketing and expand its dark store footprint.
summary_lexrank: As of August end, 43 mutual funds hold shares of Eternal, with a combined holding valued at Rs 71,746 crore.
summary_luhn: Other significant positions are held by HDFC Mutual Fund (Rs 5,218 crore), UTI Mutual Fund (Rs 5,200 crore), Nippon India Mutual Fund (Rs 5,100 crore), ICICI Prudential Mutual Fund (Rs 5,099 crore), Axis Mutual Fund (Rs 4,987 crore), Aditya Birla Sun Life Mutual Fund (Rs 3,416 crore), Franklin Templeton Mutual Fund (Rs 2,807 crore) and Canara Robeco Mutual Fund (Rs 2,617 crore).
summary_lsa: Backed by cash reserves of Rs 18,860 crore, Eternal is well placed to step up marketing and expand its dark store footprint.
summary_textrank: Other significant positions are held by HDFC Mutual Fund (Rs 5,218 crore), UTI Mutual Fund (Rs 5,200 crore), Nippon India Mutual Fund (Rs 5,100 crore), ICICI Prudential Mutual Fund (Rs 5,099 crore), Axis Mutual Fund (Rs 4,987 crore), Aditya Birla Sun Life Mutual Fund (Rs 3,416 crore), Franklin Templeton Mutual Fund (Rs 2,807 crore) and Canara Robeco Mutual Fund (Rs 2,617 crore).

title: Shakti Pumps shares jump 4% on solar water pumps supply order win
content: Shakti Pumps (India) share price gained more than 4 percent in the opening trade on September 15 following the order win worth Rs 347 crore from MSEDC for supply of solar water pumps. At 09:21am, Shakti Pumps (India) was quoting at Rs 895.95, up Rs 37.60, or 4.38 percent, on the BSE. The company is going supply and install 34,720 OffGrid DC Solar Photovoltaic Water Pumping Systems (SPWPS) under the Magel Tyala Saur Krushi Pump Yojana / PM KUSUM B by Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Co (MSEDC). On August 27, MSEDCL opened its portal for the first tranche of 10,000 SPWPS, which were fully booked with total value of approximately Rs 268.88 crore (inclusive of GST). In a second tranche 12,451 SPWPS were selected by farmers with total value of approximately Rs 347.41 crore (inclusive of GST).
summary_lexrank: Shakti Pumps (India) share price gained more than 4 percent in the opening trade on September 15 following the order win worth Rs 347 crore from MSEDC for supply of solar water pumps.

title: Alembic Pharma shares gain on EIR from USFDA for Panelav unit
content: Alembic Pharmaceuticals share price rose in the opening trade on September 15 following the company received establishment inspection report (EIR) post inspection by the US Food and Drug Administration (USFDA). At 09:20am, Alembic Pharmaceuticals was quoting at Rs 953.90, up Rs 8.10, or 0.86 percent, on the BSE. ".... has EIR today for the inspection carried out conducted from 26th May, 2025 to 31st May, 2025 by USFDA at its API - I & API - II facility located at Panelav. Last week, the company received final approval from the USFDA for its abbreviated new drug application (ANDA) Phytonadione Injectable Emulsion USP, 1 mg/0.5 mL Single-Dose Prefilled Syringe. Phytonadione Injectable Emulsion is use for the treatment of hypoprothrombinemia due to vitamin K deficiency or interference. In August, the company received final approval from USFDA for its ANDA Macitentan Tablets, 10 mg, which is use for treatment of pulmonary arterial hypertension (PAH, WHO Group I) in adults to reduce the risks of disease progression and hospitalization for PAH. Refer label for a detailed indication.

summary_luhn: Last week, the company received final approval from the USFDA for its abbreviated new drug application (ANDA) Phytonadione Injectable Emulsion USP, 1 mg/0.5 mL Single-Dose Prefilled Syringe.

title: First Tick: Top global cues to watch in today’s trade
content: Indian benchmark indices Sensex and Nifty are likely to see a positive start on September 15, tracking GIFT Nifty, which was hovering around 25,162.50. Track the latest updates on GIFT Nifty right here on Moneycontrol. Dalal Street extended the winning streak for an 8th consecutive session on September 12, with Nifty 50 comfortably closing above 25,100 for the first time since July 23, powered led by auto, pharma and metals names. This also turned out to be the biggest weekly gain in nearly three months, as BSE Sesnex and Nifty gained 1.5 percent each. At close, the Sensex was up 355.97 points or 0.44 percent at 81,904.70, and the Nifty 50 was up 108.50 points or 0.43 percent at 25,114.00. Broader indices underperformed the main indices with BSE Midcap and Smallcap indices closing with marginal gains. Here is how financial markets across the globe fared overnight: GIFT Nifty (Down) The GIFT Nifty is trading lower at around 25,162.50, indicating a negative opening start for the day. Asian Equities (Flat) Stocks got off to a quiet start in Asia on Monday ahead of an action-packed week that is seemingly certain to see the U.S. Federal Reserve resume its easing cycle, and perhaps leave the door wide open to a series of cuts. US Equities (Mixed) The Nasdaq notched a record high close on Friday in a mixed trading session, lifted by Microsoft as investors looked ahead to the Federal Reserve's policy meeting next week, when it is widely expected to cut interest rates to counter a slowdown in the jobs market. The S&P 500 declined 0.05% to end the session at 6,584.29 points. The Nasdaq gained 0.45% to 22,141.10 points, while the Dow Jones Industrial Average declined 0.59% to 45,834.22 points. Dollar Index (Flat) The dollar held steady on Monday ahead of a pivotal week filled with central bank decisions led by the Federal Reserve, while the euro hardly reacted to Fitch's downgrade of France's credit rating. Asian currencies (Mixed) Some of the Asian currencies were not trading today, while other currencies were trading mixed with Philippines Peso, Thai Baht, Taiwan Dollar were trading lower and South Korean Won, Japanese Yen, Singapore Dollar were trading with marginal gains. Crude (Gains) Oil prices were little changed on Monday as investors assessed the impact of Ukrainian drone attacks on Russian refineries that could disrupt its crude and fuel exports, while also eyeing U.S. fuel-demand growth. Gold (down) Gold held near a record as traders geared up for an anticipated easing of the US Federal Reserve’s monetary policy this week and looked for clues on further rate cuts this year. Fund Flow Action The Foreign institutional investors (FIIs) broke two-day selling streak and bought equities worth Rs 129 crore on September 12, while Domestic institutional investors (DIIs) continued their buying in this month, as they bought equities worth Rs 1556 crore on the same day. Hope you're all set for today's trade. We wish you a profitable day ahead. title: Trade Spotlight: How should you trade NMDC, Titagarh Rail, Astra Microwave, Lupin, Samvardhana Motherson, Neuland Labs, and others on September 15?
content: Equity benchmarks gained 0.4 percent on September 12, continuing their upward journey for the eighth consecutive session. The market was slightly in favour of advances, as about 1,407 shares saw buying interest compared to 1,378 shares that corrected on the NSE. The market may consolidate, but overall, the trend remains favourable for bulls. Over the past couple of weeks, rising volumes have signified increased participation. The daily, weekly, and monthly strength indicator RSI indicates rising strength. The stock is well-placed above its 20-, 50-, 100-, and 200-day SMAs, which reconfirms a bullish trend. These averages are also inching up along with the price rise, reinforcing the bullish trend. In addition, the MACD signal line has experienced a positive crossover near the zero line, contributing to the overall bullish sentiment. title: Stocks to Watch Today: Apollo Hospitals, Dr Reddys Labs, Tata Tech, Shakti Pumps, Alembic Pharma, Diamond Power, EIL, RailTel, Adani Power, Ceigall in focus on 15 September
content: Let's catch up on the latest news from the stock market. From significant investments to major deals, order wins, acquisitions, and appointments, here’s a quick look at which stocks will be in focus in today's trade: Results Today Patel Retail Quarterly Earnings Gem Aromatics Q1 (Consolidated YoY) Profit falls 7% to Rs 7.98 crore Vs Rs 8.6 crore Revenue declines 5.4% to Rs 87.6 crore Vs Rs 92.7 crore Stocks to Watch Tata Technologies The company, through its wholly owned subsidiary Tata Technologies Pte, Singapore, has signed a definitive agreement to acquire 100% equity shares in Germany-based ES-Tec GmbH and its subsidiaries (ES-Tec Group) from MW Beteiligungs GmbH for EUR 75 million. The acquisition is expected to be completed by December 2026. Shakti Pumps India The company has received a second order worth Rs 374.41 crore from Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Company (MSEDC) for the supply of 12,451 off-grid solar water pumps. With this, a total of 22,451 off-grid DC solar photovoltaic water pumps have been booked across two tranches, valuing the total order at Rs 616.30 crore. On August 12, the company received a Letter of Empanelment for the supply and installation of 34,720 off-grid solar water pumps under the Magel Tyala Saur Krushi Pump Yojana / PM-KUSUM B scheme. Alembic Pharmaceuticals The company has received an Establishment Inspection Report (EIR) from the US Food and Drug Administration (USFDA) for its API-I and API-II facilities at Panelav. The inspection was conducted from May 26 to May 31. The EIR indicates closure of inspection at the unit. Diamond Power Infrastructure The company has received a Letter of Intent from Adani Energy Solutions for the supply of 5,403 KM AL-59 Zebra conductor for the Jamnagar project, worth Rs 236.7 crore. Engineers India The company has received a contract worth Rs 618 crore from a Fertilizer Company in Africa for providing Project Management Consultancy (PMC) and Engineering Procurement and Construction Management (EPCM) services for setting up a new fertilizer plant in Africa. RailTel Corporation of India The company has received a Letter of Acceptance (LOA) for an order worth Rs 209.78 crore from the State Project Director (SPD), Bihar Education Project Council (BEPC). The project is for the implementation of education quality enhancement in Bihar under PM SHRI. Adani Power The company has signed a Power Supply Agreement with Bihar State Power Generation Company for the supply of 2,400 MW of power from a greenfield ultra-supercritical plant to be set up at Pirpainti, Bihar. Dr Reddy’s Laboratories The USFDA has completed a Pre-Approval Inspection (PAI) at the company's biologics manufacturing facility in Bachupally, Hyderabad, and issued a Form 483 with five observations. The inspection was conducted from September 4 to September 12. Ceigall India The company has emerged as the L1 bidder for a road construction project worth Rs 509.2 crore from the Greater Mohali Area Development Authority (GMADA). The project involves the construction of internal roads in Pocket B, C & D of Aerotropolis, SAS Nagar. Additionally, the company will be setting up a comprehensive oncology facility, including a Single Gantry Proton Proteus One System at Gurugram, with an investment of Rs 573 crore. The Audit Committee and Board of Directors have noted the allegations and engaged a reputed specialist law firm to conduct an independent and comprehensive investigation. To achieve the objectives of the agreement, it has incorporated a wholly owned subsidiary, Motherson Macauto Solutions. Aircraft movements during the same period dropped 4.2% to 58,813. title: Broader indices gain in second week, these smallcaps give double digit return
content: The broader indices performed inline with main indices, posting strong gains in the second consecutive week post GST rationalizations, positive global markets, hopes of ease on US-India trade tension, and DII supports. For the week, Nifty50 added 373 points or 1.50 percent to end at 25,114, while the BSE Sensex index added 1193.94 points or 1.47 percent to end at 81,904.70. BSE Largecap, Midcap and Smallcap indices rose 1.5 percent each. Foreign Institutional Investors (FIIs) extended their selling in the 11th straight week, as they offload equities worth Rs 3,577.37 crore. On the other hand, Domestic Institutional Investors (DII) continued their buying in 22nd week, as they purchased equities worth Rs 13,703.23crore. Among sectors, except Nifty Consumer Durables (down 1 percent), all other indices ended in the green with Nifty Defence index rose 7 percent, Nifty IT index jumped over 4 percent, Nifty PSU Bank index added 3 percent, while Nifty Auto, Metal, Pharma jumped 2 percent each. "Indian markets ended the week on a strong footing, with the Nifty closing above the 25,000 level and broader indices outperforming the benchmark. The upturn was supported by optimism over the anticipation of stronger H2FY26 earnings, driven by GST rationalisation and the benefits of monetary easing, which also provide resilience to valuations. Sentiment was further lifted by reports that the EU may reject U.S. tariff proposals on India’s Russian oil imports," said Vinod Nair, Head of Research, Geojit Investments. "Continued foreign outflows weighed on the rupee, while gold reached fresh highs on strong safe-haven demand amid global trade tensions. The market, however, found support in improving prospects for India–US trade negotiations, suggesting tariff-related risks may prove short-lived. Although global bond yields have risen to new peaks, investors currently do not view them as a major threat." "The IT index exhibited its rally, driven by renewed hopes of a Fed rate cut, Infosys’ buyback announcement, and optimism over a revival in technology spending. Consumer-centric sectors, particularly Auto, displayed steady resilience, supported by expectations of GST-driven demand recovery and festive season tailwinds. Domestic CPI inflation registered a slight uptick; however, ongoing tax reforms are expected to help ease pressures in the period ahead," he added The BSE Small-cap index rose 1.5 percent with Sigachi Industries, Faze Three, Precision Camshafts, SMS Pharmaceuticals, Themis Medicare, Indo Count Industries, MTAR Technologies, IOL Chemicals and Pharmaceuticals, Prime Focus, New Delhi Television, India Tourism Development Corporation, Swelect Energy Systems, Greenpanel Industries, Dilip Buildcon, Garware Hi-Tech Films, JBM Auto, Ramco Industries, Salasar Techno Engineering rising 15-36 percent. On the other hand, KR Rail Enginerring, Paradeep Phosphates, Good Luck India, Reliance Infrastructure, Vimta Labs, Rishabh Instruments, CarTrade Tech fell between 10-16 percent. Where is Nifty50 headed? Osho Krishan, Sr. Analyst – Technical & Derivatives, Angel One On the levels front, the intermediate support level is anticipated to reside within the 25000-24900 range, which is expected to provide a buffer against potential declines. Furthermore, the positive crossover of the 20 and 50 DEMA around 24800 is regarded as a critical support zone from a positional perspective. At the higher end, intermediate resistance levels are identified around 25250, followed by a bearish gap located in the 25340 zone. Nevertheless, given the current technical configuration, the range of 25500 to 25600 appears to be attainable in the near term. Amol Athawale, VP Technical Research, Kotak Securities We believe that as long as the market is trading above 25,000/81800, the bullish sentiment is likely to continue. On the higher side, 25,150–25,200/82200-82400 would act as immediate resistance zones for the bulls. A successful breakout above 25,200/82400 could push the market up toward 25,500–25,550/83300-83500. On the flip side, below 25,000/81800, the uptrend could become vulnerable. Traders may consider exiting their long positions if the market falls below this level. For Bank Nifty, the 20-day SMA and the level of 54,300 could act as key support zones. Above these levels, the pullback move could continue toward 55,300–55,500 or the 50-day SMA. Conversely, if the index falls below 54,300, it could retest levels around 54,000–53,700. Rupak De, Senior Technical Analyst at LKP Securities Nifty managed to stay in the green as put writers provided support around the 25,000 mark. The index appears to be consolidating its recent gains, gradually forming a base. As long as it sustains above 24,850, the undertone remains constructive. A decisive move beyond 25,150 may set the stage for a rally towards 25,500 in the near term. Nagaraj Shetti, Senior Technical Research Analyst at HDFC Securities The crucial hurdle of down sloping trend line and previous two weeks high has been surpassed quietly around 25000 mark and the market closed higher. Nifty closed above the weekly close of the last eight weeks at 25100 levels, which is signaling positive outlook for coming week. The underlying trend of Nifty continues to be positive. Having sustained above the key overhead resistance of 25000–25100 levels, Nifty is likely to move towards the next overhead resistance of 25350-25400 by next week. Immediate support is placed at 24900 levels. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

title: Nasdaq notches record high close, traders look to Fed meeting
content: The Nasdaq notched a record high close on Friday in a mixed trading session, lifted by Microsoft as investors looked ahead to the Federal Reserve's policy meeting next week, when it is widely expected to cut interest rates to counter a slowdown in the jobs market. Fueled by Tesla and other technology-related stocks, the Nasdaq added to a rally in the previous session that saw all three indexes hit all-time highs. Investors are laser-focused on the Fed's meeting on Tuesday and Wednesday. Traders expect the central bank to cut interest rates by 25 basis points after recent data showed longstanding weakness in hiring and easing inflation concerns. "Because we had such a nice jump in the stock market yesterday, investors are basically catching their breath," said Sam Stovall, chief investment strategist CFRA Research. "There's really not going to be any data between now and Wednesday. It's a sort of wait-and-see attitude." S&P 500 components so far in 2025 Microsoft gained 1.8% after the technology giant avoided a possible hefty EU antitrust fine by offering customers reduced prices for Office products excluding Teams. Tesla jumped 7.4% after board chair Robyn Denholm dismissed concerns that CEO Elon Musk's political activity had hurt sales at the electric-vehicle maker and said the billionaire was "front and center" at the company after several months at the White House. With Friday's surge, Tesla shares remain down 2% in 2025. Declines in Goldman Sachs and paint-maker Sherwin-Williams kept the Dow Jones Industrial Average in negative territory. The S&P 500 declined marginally. The University of Michigan's survey showed U.S. consumer sentiment fell for a second straight month in September as consumers saw rising risks to business conditions, the labor market and inflation. The S&P 500 declined 0.05% to end the session at 6,584.29 points. The Nasdaq gained 0.45% to 22,141.10 points, while the Dow Jones Industrial Average declined 0.59% to 45,834.22 points. Seven of the 11 S&P 500 sector indexes declined, led lower by health care, down 1.13%, followed by a 0.97% loss in materials (.SPLRCM), opens new tab. Following signs of a worsening jobs market, interest rate futures reflect expectations of cuts totaling 75 basis points by the end of the year. For the week, the S&P 500 rose 1.6%, the Dow climbed almost 1% and the Nasdaq added 2%, helped by a revival in artificial intelligence trade after cloud computing giant Oracle's strong forecast on Tuesday. Warner Bros Discovery jumped 17%, extending a surge from Wednesday, when a source said Paramount Skydance was preparing a bid for the struggling media company. Shares of vaccine makers fell after a report said U.S. health officials are planning to link coronavirus vaccines to the deaths of 25 children. Moderna declined 7.4%, while Pfizer and Novavax both lost more than 3%. Declining stocks outnumbered rising ones within the S&P 500 by a 3.3-to-one ratio. The S&P 500 posted 22 new highs and 3 new lows; the Nasdaq recorded 106 new highs and 43 new lows.
summary_lexrank: The S&P 500 declined 0.05% to end the session at 6,584.29 points.
summary_luhn: The Nasdaq notched a record high close on Friday in a mixed trading session, lifted by Microsoft as investors looked ahead to the Federal Reserve's policy meeting next week, when it is widely expected to cut interest rates to counter a slowdown in the jobs market.
summary_lsa: S&P 500 components so far in 2025 Microsoft gained 1.8% after the technology giant avoided a possible hefty EU antitrust fine by offering customers reduced prices for Office products excluding Teams.

title: Societe Generale picks small stakes in Bank of Baroda, Eicher Motors, Max Financial, PFC from Marshall Wace
content: France-headquartered Societe Generale has acquired small stakes in four companies - Eicher Motors, Bank of Baroda, Max Financial, Power Finance Corporation (PFC) from hedge fund of Marshall Wace via open market transactions on September 12. Eicher Motors shares closed the session with 1.73 percent gains at Rs 6,875, however, PFC corrected nearly 1 percent to Rs 395.70, Bank of Baroda fell 0.33 percent to Rs 237.48, and Max Financial declined 1.16 percent to Rs 1,586.7 on the NSE. Societe Generale has bought 64,16,414 equity shares (equivalent to 0.12 percent stake) in Bank of Baroda at Rs 238.27 per share for Rs 152.88 crore, and 24,37,238 shares (0.07 percent) in PFC at Rs 399.55 per share for Rs 97.4 crore from Marshall Wace Investment Strategies - Eureka Fund. Further, Societe Generale purchased 60,405 shares (0.02%) in Eicher Motors at Rs 6,758 per share for Rs 40.82 crore, and 74,675 shares (0.02% stake) in Max Financial Services at Rs 1,605.4 per share for Rs 11.98 crore from Marshall Wace. Tega Industries, the consumables manufacturer for the mining, mineral processing, and material handling industries, was also in focus, falling 1.06 percent to Rs 2,016.10 amid big volumes. Investment company Plutus Wealth Management acquired 5.15 lakh shares (0.77 percent stake) at Rs 1,963.2 per share in the company for Rs 101.1 crore. ASK Financial Holdings bought 84.75 lakh units (0.63 percent) at Rs 133 per unit in Cube Highways Trust for Rs 112.7 crore. The action was also seen in PE Analytics, the SME company, which rallied 3.3 percent to Rs 199. Promoter Samir Jasuja bought 4.62 lakh shares (4.4 percent stake) at Rs 175 per share for Rs 8.08 crore, however, Barca Global Master Fund sold 4,89,600 shares (4.67 percent stake) at same price for Rs 8.56 crore. In Greenlam Industries, Upnishad Trustee Advisory Services bought 94,36,480 shares at Rs 240.6 per share for Rs 227.04 crore from Hydra Trading. The stock was up 1.9 percent.
